Hd1iIL5E.title: Laser in the treatment of cicatrice
Hd1iIL5E.abstract: OBJECTIVE:To introduce the clinical study of laser curing cicatrices in recent 20 years so as to investigate the further progress of laser treatment.DATA SOURCES:The Pubmed and China Biomedicine Database were retrieved to search relevant articles during 1983-2006,with the retrieval words of "cicatrices,laser" in both English and Chinese.STUDY SELECTION:After the first trial on the data,the studies containing clinical experiments were selected for full texts.Inclusive standard:①a definite diagnosing standard.②randomized-controlled experiment or check test,no matter follow-ups or blind.③the intervention in curing group included laser or laser allying with medicine;the intervention in control set was consisted of triamcinolone acetonide,freezing triamcinolone acetonide,or no medicine.Exclusive standard:①non-contrast study.②the intervention of curing group or control set was in inconformity to standard.③mechanism studies.④repetition studies.DATA EXTRACTION:A total of 120 relevant documents were collected and 31 of them were included according to the above-mentioned standard,while the other documents were removed equally.DATA SYNTHESIS:Among 31 articles,11 studies were the randomized contrasts,10 the controlled researches that every study lasted for 1-6 months.Every research involved in 10-50 examples.Six studied the curative effect and security of laser and traditional medication for curing cicatrices,two paralleled the mechanism of basic research of the laser in treatment of cicatrices,ten observed the curative effect of combined treatment and simple medicine or simple laser to cicatrices,four compared the curative effect of Western medicine allied the laser for curing cicatrices,two studied the side effect of laser curing cicatrices,and seven introduced the researches of cicatrices treatment in the homeland or abroad.CONCLUSION:The laser for curing the cicatrices is reliably in curative effect,little in side effect,simple in operation,tall in security,and easy accepted by patients.Due to certain limitation in treatment of cicatrices by laser,further study in the field of laser penetration depth is needed.

HCUAGHLl.title: The use of the fractional CO2 laser resurfacing in the treatment of photoaging in Asians: five years long-term results.
HCUAGHLl.abstract: The purpose of this clinical paper is to explore the therapeutic effects, healing times, adverse effects, and maintenance periods of using a CO2 fractional laser in the treatment of photoaging in Asian skin.One fractional CO2 laser procedure was performed on the full face in 56 patients with photoaging. Based on the Dover scoring system, we evaluated the degree of skin aging before treatment and at one-month post laser and at five years post laser therapy in 30 of the patients. Statistical analysis was performed by the Wilcoxon's method.Thirty of the treated patients have had follow-up for 5 years at this time. The photoaging scores in these thirty patients were significantly changed (P < 0.01) at one month, one year, and five years after the fractional laser treatment, as compared with their baseline. Adverse events seen during this analysis were found to be minimal and not of clinical significance.Fractional CO2 laser resurfacing in the treatment of photoaging in Asians is a useful modality with results, for the first time, being shown to have continued efficacy for up to 5 years.

BAFV2N4d.title: Association of HIF-1α expression and VEGF,HO-1 in scars
BAFV2N4d.abstract: Objective To explore the mechanism of hypoxia inducible factor 1α(HIF-1α) ameliorating the hypoxia in the course of scar maturation. Methods Expression of HIF-1α,vascular endothelial growh factor(VEGF),and heme oxygenase-1(HO-1) in burn wound granulation,burn scars of different stages,and normal skin were detected by immunohistochemical staining, The expressions were quantified by weight method,and then the relationships between HIF-1α and VEGF,HO-1 were investigated. Results With the scar maturarion, the expression of HIF-1α,VEGF,HO-1 were all gradually decreased .There were both positive relationships between HIF-1α and VEGF(P<0.01), between HIF-1αand HO-1(P<0.01). Conclusion HIF-1αinduces VEGF and HO-1 expression, VEGF promotes angiogenesis,and HO-1 advances vessel maturation,which increase offering oxygen,then the hypoxia is gradually ameliorated during the scar maturarion.

jwlgcbv1.title: Intense pulsed light treatment of hyperpigmentation and unwanted hairs of facial skin grafts
jwlgcbv1.abstract: Objective To observe the clinical effect of Intense pulsed light treatment of hyperpigmentation and unwanted hairs of facial skin grafts.Methods 11 cases of post-transplantation skin hyperpigmentation were treated with IPL.2 of them presented unwanted hair growth as well.1 ～3 sessions of IPL treatment were conducted to eliminate the hyperpigmentation while 3 sessions were added for hair removal.Results 7 of 11 cases got extraordinarily improved and the other 4 got fairly improved.Slight side effects were observed.2 cases with unwanted hairs got extraordinary hair reduction.Conclusion IPL offers an effective and safe option to treat hyperpigmentation and unwanted hairs of facial Skin grafts.

5fcAXKjK.title: Effects of correcting brow ptosis in the treatment of crow's feet by botulinum toxin A
5fcAXKjK.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of correcting brow ptosis in the treatment of crow's feet by botulinum toxin A. Methods Patients simple for the treatment of crow's feet were randomly enrolled in this study.The crow's feet was treated with symmmtry and multi-point injection of botulinum toxin A.The effect of treating crow's feet was observed.Vertical dimensions extending from medial canthus,midpupil,lateral canthus to the superior margin of brow were measured at prior-treatment and post-treatment. Results Nine cases were enrolled .The vertical dimensions extending from medial canthus,midpupil,lateral canthus to the superior margin of brow were (3.17±0.21)cm,(2.43±0.24)cm,(2.92±0.44)cm at prior-treatment,and(3.18±0.21)cm,(2.43±0.23)cm,(3.14±0.45)cm(P<0.01) at two weeks post treatment respectively.The effective rate of treating wrinkles was 100%. Conclusion Brow ptosis can be effectively corrected in the treatment of crow's feet by botulinum toxin A.

O7sPTSxt.title: Transcriptional Regulation of Heat Shock Transcription Factor 1 on TNF-α and its Mechanisms
O7sPTSxt.abstract: Objective To study the transcriptional regulation of heat shock transcription factor 1(HSF1) on TNF-α and explore its mechanisms.Methods The eukaryotic expression vector containing mouse HSF1,pcDNA3.1-HSF1,luciferase reporter gene containing mouse TNF-α wild type promoter,pGL3-TNFα-Y,and luciferase reporter gene containing mouse TNF-α mutant type promoter,pGL3-TNFα-T,were constructed.The pcDNA3.1-HSF1 was transfected into mouse macrophage RAW264.7,and the expression of TNF-α mRNA was determined by semi-quantitative RT-PCR.The pcDNA3.1-HSF1 and the luciferase reporter gene containing mouse TNF-α promoter were co-transfected into RAW264.7,and the relative luciferase activities of pGL3-TNFα-Y and pGL3-TNFα-T were determined and compared.Results HSF1 could downregulate the expression of TNF-α mRNA in RAW264.7.The relative luciferase activity of pGL3-TNFα-T was significantly lower than that of pGL3-TNFα-Y(P<0.01).Conclusions HSF1 downregulates the expression of TNF-α mRNA in RAW264.7 by binding with the HSE in the promoter of TNF-α.

nqGqfXFz.title: Study on treatment of face atrophic acne scar by Encore ActiveFXTM CO_2 lasers
nqGqfXFz.abstract: Objective The study was to investigate the application of lattic CO2 laser in the treatment of face atrophic acne scar.Methods The Encore ActiveFXTM CO2 laser was used to treated 40 cases of atrophic acne scar twice,applicating B.Dreno's ECCA grading scale to grade this acne scar cases post and after treatment,and compared these data.Results The average improvement is 55%,and the efficiency rate is 90%.Conclusion The lattic CO2 laser can treat the face atrophic acne scar efficiently.

IOoK2Rai.title: The Application of Eschar Open Decompression in Treating Face-Neck Deep Burns.
IOoK2Rai.abstract: Objective:To explore the efficacy of eschar open decompression in treating face-neck deep burns. Methods:Six patients of face-neck deep burns with gentle inhalation injury were randomly enrolled in the study.The es- char open decompression were executed in both cervical parts at the early stage after burn.Then the cervical sensation,air- way obstruction and incision wound were observed.Results:Three of 6 patients had cervical girdle sensation.Their cervi- cal girdle sensation were obviously relieved when both cervical parts were performed with eschar open decompression.The eschar open decompression were also performed in rest 3 patients in prevention.All 6 patients had no airway obstruction in the follow treatment.The incision wounds of 4 cases healed spontaneously and rest 2 via skin grafL No bleeding and infec- tion or other severe complication were observed.Condusion:Early eschar open decompression can effectively prevent early airway obstruction so as not to incise trachea in severely burned patients with face-neck deep burns.

7rlBP8sw.title: Effects of hypoxia on the expression of hypoxia inducible factor 1 alpha in scar firbroblasts
7rlBP8sw.abstract: Aim: To explore relationship between extent of hypoxia and exprssion of hypoxia inducible factor 1α(HIF-1α) in scar fibroblasts. Methods: The experiment was conducted in the Central Laboratory of Xiangya Hospital from January to March 2004. Cicatricles of burnt patients 3-6 months after healed were taken as subjects. Scar fibroblasts isolately cultured in vitro were inspected with immunohistochemical staining and Western Blot for expression of HIF-1α 24 hours after cultured with the volume fraction of theoxygen concentration of 0.2, 0.1, 0.05 and 0.015. Results: 1 Immunohistochemical staining: There were expressions of HIF-1α in cellular nucleus and cell-substance, signal intensities of expression of HIF-1α under the volume fraction of theoxygen concentration of 0.2, 0.1, 0.05 and 0.015 were respectively 47.50±9.29, 96.00±18.29, 209.17 ±19.64 and 263.83 ±13.24, differences of comparion in different concentrations were significant (F=261.01, P < 0.01). Partial expressions of HIF-1α were weakly positive (WP) in 0.2 O 2 and were fundamentally in WP in 0.1 O 2. While expressions of HIF-1α in 0.5 O 2 were mainly positive and that in 0.015 O 2 were fundamentally positive. 2 Western Blot inspection: Relative amounts of protein expression of HIF-1α in 0.2, 0.1, 0.05, 0.015 O 2 were respectively 0.02,0.26, 0.39 and 0.97, which were in increasing tendency and higher than that in 0.2 O 2. Conclusion: With the decreasing of O 2 concentration, expression of HIF-1α in scar fibroblasts is strengthened gradually. Expressive intensity of HIF-1α can indirectly reflect the concentration of O 2 in scar tissues.

ILNs5gmw.title: The analysis of 287 Acquired bilateral nevus of Ota-like macules(ABNOM) treated with Q-switched Lasers
ILNs5gmw.abstract: Objective To discuss the therapeutic effect of Acquired bilateral nevus of Ota-like macules(ABNOM) treated with Q-switched lasers.Methods 287 cases of ABNOM were treated with Q-switched alexandrite laser,Nd:YAG laser or Double-frequency Nd:YAG laser seperatedly.Results After 1～13 times of treatments,140 cases were cured,66 cases showed marked improvement,59 cases had fare blanching and 22 cases were evaluated as uneffective.The gross effective rate were 71.8%,and the completely recovered rate were 48.8%.The patients treated with doublefrequency Nd:YAG laser showed more rapid response and underwent more obvious side-effects than with the other two lasers.Conclusions the Q-switched lasers are effective for treating ABNOM.To achieve safe and satisfactory recovery of ABNOM,long term and low energy Q-switched alexandrite or Nd:YAG laser is recommended.
keywords: Acquired bilateral nevus of Ota-like macules(ABNOM)

8otmJAus.title: Distribution characteristics of epidermal stem cells after treatment with fractional cO2 laser in a model of skin photoaging
8otmJAus.abstract: BACKGROUND: There has been some progress in clinical application of fractional CO2 laser for treatment of facial photoaging. However, little is known about the change law of epidermal stem cells during wound healing process after treatment with fractional CO2laser in a model of skin photoaging. OBJECTIVE: To investigate the quantity and distribution of epidermal stem cells during wound healing process after treatment with fractional CO2 laser in a mouse model of skin photoaging. METHODS: Ten Kunming mouse models of skin photoaging developed by exposure to ultraviolet radiation were treated with fractional CO2 laser (Deep FX). Wound healing was monitored and samples were harvested for determination of keratin 19 ad P63 expression by immunohistochemical staining before and 1, 3, 7 and 15 days after fractional CO2 laser treatment. RESULTS AND CONCLUSION: The wounds almost healed at 15 days after treatment. Compared to before and day 1 treatment, Keratin 19 and P63 expression on day 3 were significantly increased, and keratin 19- and P63-positive cells were distributed in larger areas. Compared to days 1 and 3 of treatment, keratin 19- and P63-positive cells were significantly higher in quality and peaked on day 7 of treatment, and they were disorderly arranged in each epidermal layer. On day 15 of treatment, keratin 19- and P63-positive cells decreased in number and only accumulated in epidermal basal lamina and hair follicle eminence, and there was no significant difference in keratin 19- and P63-positive expression as compared with before and day 1 of treatment. These findings suggest that epidermal stem cells participate in the repair progress of skin photoaging in mice receiving fractional CO2 laser treatment and may play an important role in this process.

qHYT975r.title: The Application of the Photoaging Treated with Nonablative Approach
qHYT975r.abstract: Objective:To introduce the clinical study of nonablative approach for the Treatment of Photoaging in recent 10 years,so as to investigate the further progress of nonablative approach treatment.Method:The Pubmed and China Biomedicine Database were retrieved to search relevant articles during1999-2009,witthe retrieval words of"photoaging,laser, Intense pulsed light,radiofrequency,Light Emitting Diode"in both English and Chinese.After the first trial on the data, the studies containing clinical experiments were selected for full texts innclusive standard:a definite diagnosing standard; randomized-controlled experiment or check test.Result:A total of 110 relevant documents were collected and 23 of them were included according to the above-mentioned standard,while the other documents were removed equally.Conclusion: Nonablative approach for the treatment of photoaging is reliably in curative effect,little in side effect,simple in operation,tall in security,and easy accepted by patients.Regardless of which method to use a separate treatment of skin photoaging its effects are not very perfect,we must work closely with the disease in patients with specific conditions and nonablative rejuvenation equipment,the performance of personalized treatment.

9IU8ul0V.title: Red Scars in Hypertrophic Stage with Variable Pulsed Nd∶YAG 532 nm Laser:a Clinical Observation
9IU8ul0V.abstract: Objective To evaluate the curative effect of variable pulsed Nd ∶YAG 532 nm laser treating red scars in hypertrophic stage.Methods Ninety patients with 120 scars were involved.Treatment parameters of laser were variable(pulsewidth:20-40 ms,energy fluency:22-40 J/cm2,diameter:3 mm).The effective rate was evaluated to the strip scars in the operative incisions and the lamellar scars in the contused or burned wounds.Results The signs and symptoms of red scars were relieved afer treatment.The effective rate and curative rate after 4 times of treatment were 100.0% and 95.0% to the strip scars and,90.0% and 70.0% to the lamellar scars respectively.Conclusions Treating red scars in hypertrophic stage with variable pulsed Nd ∶YAG 532nm laser is effective.

JnkJILrf.title: Application of mimic design in the psychological nursing of the rhinoplasty patients
JnkJILrf.abstract: Objective To investigate the psychological care effectiveness of simulation software for rhinoplasty patients.Methods rhinoplasty consultants were randomly divided into software design group and control group.The software design took photos using digital camera from different angles,with the help of Mirror issued facial photos of rhinoplasty form design software of digital speciation analysis.We could use the analysis to assist consultation,guide operation and have simultaneously purposeful mental nursing.The control group underwent regular consultation and operation without using Mirror shape design software.By comparing the rate of operation after consultation and satisfaction between the two groups,we can evaluate the role of software simulation design to design rhinoplasty patients in psychological nursing Results There were 48 persons in each group.In software design group,the number of those who underwent surgery after consultation was 42 and 36 cases of the postoperative satisfaction.In the control group,the number of those who underwent surgery after consultation was 33 and that of postoperative satisfaction was 27 cases.With the comparison,the rate of operation after consultation in software design group is higher than that of the control(P<0.05) and the rate of surgery satisfaction in software design group is higher than that in control group(P>0.05).Conclusions Mirror shape design software simulation designed to help patients in the preoperative to know the anticipated results preliminary and cooperate with the doctor.And it would meet the psychological needs of patients and is useful for strengthening the interaction between doctors and patients,enabling targeted psychological nursing intervention and improving the success rate of operation after the consultation
keywords: Mirror shape design software simulation design

gZNoK57S.title: Expression of vascular endothelial growth factor and hypoxia-inducible factor-1 alpha during scar mutation in rabbit ears
gZNoK57S.abstract: BACKGROUND:Scar studies have cover histological,cellular and molecular levels nearly 20 years,but the mechanism of scar formation is not clarified.How to explore an ideal method for preventing and treating scar is an urgent and difficult task in both medical field and clinical application.OBJECTIVE:To investigate molecular mechanism of scar formation by observing expression of vascular endothelial growth factor(VEGF) and hypoxia-inducible factor-1 α(HIF-1α) during scar mutation in rabbit ears.METHODS:A rabbit ears scar animal model was prepared,normal skin and scars at 14,30,60 and 90 days were collected.Histomorphological changes of scars were observed by hematoxylin-eosin staining and the expression of VEGF and HIF-1α was detected by immunohistochemical method.RESULTS AND CONCLUSION:Compared with other time points,the expression of VEGF and HIF-1α was greater at 14 days after operation,and gradually decreased with time prolonged and scar mature,which close to normal levels at 90 days after operation.The findings demonstrated that HIF-1α and VEGF play a regulation role in oxygen partial pressure changes of scar tissues.

DSUpkjLt.title: Clinical observation of treating superficial scars in the face and neck with fractional laser
DSUpkjLt.abstract: Objective To sum up the clinical experience of treating superficial scars in the face and neck with fractional laser and observe the curative effect.Methods The superficial scars caused by acne,incision,contusion and burn were treated with ActiveFX UltraPulse Encore fractional laser.The curative rate were evaluated.Results 50 patients were involved.The total curative rate after one time treatment was 62%.After laser treatment,the wound healing time was 5 ～14 days,mean 9 days.the complications including infection,hypertrophic scar,hyperpigmentation,depigmentation were seldom occurred.Conclusion Treating the superficial scar in the face and neck with fractional laser can achieve satisfactory effect.

vrDPn46z.title: Research progress in anti-scar effect of cytokines
vrDPn46z.abstract: Scar is the inevitable result of wound healing.There are a number of factors which cause the generation of scars.Al- though there has been some progress in the field of the disease rational scar from the research of domestic and foreign scholars,its precise mechanism has not yet fully been elucidated.The present study on the treatment of scar mainly focuses on biochemistry,cell level,the molecular mechanisms and genetic research and these aspects are growing in the level of depth.That the cytokines plays a key role in the regulation of the formation of scar has been gradually formed a consensus and the cytokines is introduced into the treatment of scars. Common cytokines will become possible in the application of anti-scar.This article introduces the biological characteristics of a common cytokines in wound repair and the anti-scar research.

16Njlh58.title: Combination of Q-switched alexandrite laser and Q-switched Nd:YAG laer treatment of 450 nevus of ota
16Njlh58.abstract: [Objective] To discuss the therapeutic effect of Nevus of Ota treated with Q-switched alexandrite laser and Q-switched Nd:YAG laer. [Methods] 450 cases of Nevus of Ota were treated with Q-switched alexandrite laser and Q-switched Nd:YAG laer. [Results] After 2~11 combined treatments, 367 cases got perfect,54 cases got good, and 29 cases were fairly improved. Slight reverse reaction was observed. [Conclusions] Q-switched alexandrite laser combined with Q-switched Nd:YAG laer is an effective and safe method for treating Nevus of Ota.

8NEPjy9b.title: Construction of a eukaryotic expression vector containing mouse heat shock transcription factor 1
8NEPjy9b.abstract: BACKGROUND: Heat shock transcription factor 1 has heat shock response effect. OBIECTIVE: To construct a eukaryotic expression vector containing mouse heat shock transcription factor 1 (HSF1). METHODS: Amplified mouse HSF1 cDNA fragment was cloned into pcDNA3.1 to construct a eukaryotic expression vector pcDNA3.1-HSF1. RESULTS AND CONCLUSION: There were two fragments in electrophoresis after restriction enzyme digestion, 5.5 kb fragment and 1.5 kb fragment. The result of DNA sequencing showed that the sequence of the cloned HSF1 was identical to that GeneBank had reported. HSF1 protein band with the relative molecular mass of 72 000 was detected by western blot. These findings indicate that the eukaryotic expression vector pcDNA3.1-HSF1 containing mouse HSF1 is successfully constructed.

ogFeB0Hs.title: Construction of Luciferase Expression Vector Containing Mouse IL-10 Promoter
ogFeB0Hs.abstract: Objective To construct the luciferase expression vector containing mouse IL-10 promoter. Methods The fragment of IL-10 promoter was amplified from mouse genomic DNA by polymerase chain reaction(PCR).The amplified fragment was subsequently cloned into PGL3-basic.The recombinant plasmid was confirmed by restriction enzyme digestion and sequencing comparison. Results There were two fragments(4 800 bp and 682 bp) in electrophoresis after restriction enzyme digestion.The result of DNA sequencing showed that the sequence of the cloned IL-10 promoter was identical to that GeneBank had reported. Conclusions The luciferase expression vector containing mouse IL-10 promoter pGL3-IL10 is constructed successfully,and it will become the essential material for further study.

jd3qO4sp.title: Curative effect of fractional laser on treating various scars
jd3qO4sp.abstract: Objective Curative effect of fractional laser on treating various scars was evaluated and experience was summarized.Methods One hundred and sixty-six cases were treated twice by fractional CO2 laser.According to the clinical evaluation standard,the curative rate was counted.Result The total effective rate was 96%,marked effective rate was 62%,after treated by fractional CO2 laser.Conclusion Fractional CO2 laser can be used to treat various scars efficiently and safely.

I8AzM00T.title: Treating the peri-orbita rhytides with Polaris WR~(TM)
I8AzM00T.abstract: Objective To evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Elos technology which combined radiofrequency and diode laser.Methods 117 patients with the apparent peri-orbita rhytides received six treatments at 3 weeks intervals with Elos equipment-Polaris WR TM.Clinical improvement was determined through photographs assessment by two independent assessors at 3 ～ 6 weeks after the final treatment using Seeman's quartile grading scale.Results After the final treatment,the average improvement grade is 1.90.Conclusion Polaris WRTM can safe and effective for treatment the peri-orbita rhytides.

ZLPdXNJU.title: Changes in oxygen partial pressure in rabbit ear scar tissues during the mature process
ZLPdXNJU.abstract: Mature animal models of rabbit ear scars were made from formation to maturation. Tissue oxygen partial pressure was determined by percutaneous oxygen monitoring at 14, 30, 60 and 90 days, and then pathology examination was performed. Fourteen days after surgery, bright red granulation tissues had a large number of inflammatory cells and angiogenesis; oxygen partial pressure was (0.81±0.25) kPa. Thirty days after surgery, the scars were significantly higher than the normal skin, bright red, made up of a large number of fibroblasts and capillary in the organizations; the partial pressure of oxygen was (1.98± 0.26) kPa. At 60 days after surgery, the scars were shrinking; color was light; the organization fibroblast cells and microvessel decreased; partial pressure oxygen was (1.86±0.60) kPa. Ninety days after surgery, the scars were flat; color was white; organizational structure was closed to normal skin; oxygen partial pressure was (13.70±1.16) kPa (P < 0.01). During the scar maturation process, the tissue oxygen partial pressure dramatically increases. Improving the organization oxygen may help prevent scars forming.

obe33b67.title: Construction of Luciferase Expression Vector Containing Mouse HMGB1 Mutant Type Promoter
obe33b67.abstract: Objective To construct the luciferase expression vector containing mouse HMGB1 mutant type promoter.Methods The luciferase expression vector containing mouse HMGB1 wild type promoter,pGL3-HMGB1-Y,was constructed after the fragment of HMGB1 promoter was amplified by PCR.The luciferase reporter gene containing mouse HMGB1 mutant type promoter,pGL3-HMGB1-T,was constructed after the mouse HMGB1 wild type promoter was mutated by overlap extension PCR.Sequence alignment was conducted between pGL3-HMGB1-Y and pGL3-HMGB1-T.Results The sequence comparision showed that HSE core base-TTCGAGAA-of pGL3-HMGB1-Y had been mutated into-TACGAGCC-.Conclusions The luciferase expression vector containing mouse HMGB1 mutant type promoter,pGL3-HMGB1-T,is successfully constructed.It will provide essential material for studying the transcriptional regulation of heat shock transcription factor 1(HSF1) on HMGB1.

ii7fhtic.title: The therapeutic comparison of variable pulsed frequecny doubled Nd:YAG laser with asiaticocide cream in hypertrophic scar revision
ii7fhtic.abstract: Objective To compare the therapeutic effect of Variable Pulsed Frequency Doubled Nd:YAG Laser with Asiaticocide cream in hypertrophic Scar Revision.WT5"HZ]Methods A hundred and sixty-four cases of hypertrophic scar patients were divided randomly into groups A and B,118 patients in group A accepted variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG laser treatment with laser pulse widths(10～40 ms) and fluences(12～32 J/cm2) which were adjusted according to skin type,scar color,thickness and immediate response over a course of 1～3 treatments with 1～3 month intervals;46 patients in group B were treated with Asiaticocide cream.Asiaticocide cream was used twice daily with local massage for 6～9 months.Results In group A 75 cases showed excellent clearance,35 cases showed good clearance,and the remaining 8 cases showed fair clearance,In group B 5 cases showed excellent clearance,28 cases showed good clearance,and the remaining 13 cases showed fair clearance.Conclusion Variable pulsed 532 nm laser is a novel method for treating hypertrophic scars with faster,better and more stable results.
keywords: Variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG Laser

kVllR6ph.title: The changes of apoptosis rate of fibroblasts and VEGF secretion after the treatment of fractional CO_2 laser on hypertrophic scars model in rabbit ear
kVllR6ph.abstract: Objective To prove the efficacy of fractional CO2 laser on hypertrophic scars in the rabbit ear model and analyse the changes of the apoptosis rate of fibroblasts and VEGF secretion after the treatment of fractional CO2 laser on hypertrophic scars.Methods Establish the hypertrophic scar models on rabbit ear in 20 rabbits.Set the treatment group and control group randomly.The treatment group were treated with fractional CO2 laser three weeks after the surgery,the control group got no special treatment.Take photos on day 1,3,7,14,28 after the laser treatment group got the laser treatment and cut off the scar specimen.To detect the the changs of the fibroblasts apoptosis rate with TUNEL and the changs of VEGF with ElivisionTM plus immunohistochemical method.Results The time of hyprotrophic scar became soft and smooth in treatment group is shorter than in control group.Fibroblast apoptosis rate increase and VEGF expression decrease after the laser treatment.Conclusion The fractional CO2 laser can promote the hypertrophic scars become soft and smooth and promote fibroblast apoptosis,decreasing the expression of VEGF on rabbit ear.One of the mechanism of fractional CO2laser on treating hypertrophic scars in the rabbit ear model perhaps is promote fibroblast apoptosis,decrease the expression of VEGF.

32xr55Dg.title: Effects of different hypoxia on proliferation of dermal scar fibroblasts
32xr55Dg.abstract: Objective To explore the effects of different hypoxia on proliferation of dermal scar fibroblasts. Methods Dermal scar fibroblasts in vitro cultured for 3～4 days were placed in an incubator with levels at 20%, 10%, 5%, 1.5% O_2 and were removed at 24?h intervals for study. Cell proliferation was determined by cell counting and PCNA expression by immunohistochemical staining. Results With the O_2 concentrations decreasing, dermal scar fibroblast cell counting was increased and the expressions of PCNA were strengthened gradually. Conclusions Hypoxia can induce dermal scar fibroblast proliferation. Decreasing hypoxia may be advantageous to prevent scar proliferation.

HcBcmUNc.title: Evaluation and selecting indications for the treatment of improving facial morphology by masseteric injection of botulinum toxin type A.
HcBcmUNc.abstract: Few reports exist on effective methods of evaluating the effects and selecting indications for the treatment of improving facial morphology by masseteric injection of botulinum toxin type A. The method for selecting indicative factors, as determined by the change of masseteric area volume at a standard frontal view when tightly clenching teeth, was used in this study. Patients with varying masseteric area volume were randomly enrolled. Bilateral masseteric muscles were treated with multi-point percutaneous intramuscular injections of botulinum toxin type A, 30-50 u for each side. Changes in facial appearance and satisfaction of patients were observed and standard frontal view photographs were taken pre-treatment and 2-3 months post-treatment. Following this, the anterior facial height(FH), bizygomatic facial width (FWz) and intergonial width (FWg) were measured from the photographs. The indices of FH/FWz and FWg/FWz were calculated and analysed. The results showed that the volume of masseteric area was reduced and the facial morphology was improved at 2-4 weeks post-injection, with maximum reduction at 2-3 months post-injection. All of the 32 patients were satisfied with the clinical effects. The pre-treatment and post-treatment values of FH/FWz were 0.8309±0.0423 and 0.8331±0.0382, respectively, and FWg/FWz values were 0.8281±0.0209 and 0.7925±0.0206 (P<0.01), respectively. In conclusion, the appropriateness of masseteric injection of botulinum toxin type A for improving facial morphology can be determined by the changes in masseteric area volume at a standard frontal view of tightly clenched teeth. In addition, the facial index of FWg/FWz can be used to evaluate the treatment.

f5wyo6xJ.title: A Experimental Study on Variable Pulse Frequency Doubled Nd:YAG Laser Treatment of Rabbit Ears Hypertrophic Scars
f5wyo6xJ.abstract: Objective: To explore the treatment effect of variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG laser on the hypertrophic scars of rabbit ears.Methods: Rabbit ear models of hypertrophic scars were built.On the 30th day after injury,the rabbit ear scars were treated with variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG Laser,the scars were observed morphologically and histologically.The vascular endothelial growth factor(VEGF) expression was detected with immunohistochemistry.Results: After treatment,the rabbit ear hypertrophic scars were noticeablly shrinked,and the VEGF expression decreased significantly.Conclusions: Variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG laser may destroy the microvessels and promote scars shrink.It provides a treatment option for early hypertrophic scar.
keywords: variable pulsed frequency doubled Nd:YAG Laser

8kyXSXGr.title: Temporal rotation skin flap combined with cartilage plasty for correcting cryptotia]
8kyXSXGr.abstract: To explore the therapeutic effect of the temporal rotation flap combined with cartilage plasty for cryptotia correction.From January 2009 to June 2012, 8 cases with cryptotia (10 ears) were treated. After complete dissection of the cartilage adhesion, the cartilage was reshaped by suture to restore its appearance. Then the temporal triangular rotation flap was transferred to cover the wound.No hematoma, infection or flap necrosis happened. The follow-up period ranged from 3 months to 1 year, with an average of (6.88 +/- 2.85) months. The ear appearance kept stable with no recurrence and inconspicuous scar. Satisfactory result was achieved.Temporal rotation flap combined with cartilage plasty is a good option for correction of mild or moderate cryptotia.

jEjrZe9C.title: Treatment strategy of the complication caused by fillers in rhinoplasty
jEjrZe9C.abstract: ve: Objective To explore the best treatment options of complications after filler injections for augmentation rhinoplasty. Methods 21 cases of postoperative complications caused by filler injections for augmentation rhinoplasty were retrospectively analyzed and the strategy of treatment was formed. Results All complications are handled properly,the patients were quite satisfactory.Conclusion Timely and reasonable use of antibiotics,debridement,drainage and tension reduction,microcirculation improvement,skin regeneration treatment,proper surgical repair,laser scar treatment are helpful for the treatment of fillers augmentation rhinoplasty.

4HxB5Ln4.title: Laser Wounds Repaired.
4HxB5Ln4.abstract: Laser is a light beam of pure color,energy highly centered,ballistic direction single,and widely ap- plied to treat superficial diseases of skin.The principle of treating skin diseases by laser is to utilize its light and heat effect to make tissues solidified and vaporized so as to eliminate pathologically changed tissues.In the meantime of this treating process,however,varying-degree skin injuries were produced and corresponding thermal damages of skin were formed. Thermal damages with essential principle similar to burns wounds need to be treated with proper methods.Pigmentation and scar formation would occur if they were treated inappropriately.In this paper,classification,repairing methods,main points of treating et al of laser wounds were reviewed to provide theory bases to choose correct therapy for laser wounds.

HmijaYts.title: Application of botulinum toxin A injection for calf reduction
HmijaYts.abstract: Objective To discuss the effect of botulinum toxin A injection for calf reduction.Methods Eleven patients who want calf reduction were enrolled and were injected botulinum toxin A 300～400U in calf on both sides.The biggest calf perimeter were measured per-operation and 3 months after operation.Results The average reduction of biggest calf perimeter were 1.62±0.88cm in 3 months after operation,and the average reduction rate were 4.65%±2.42%.There was significant difference between before and after operation.Conclusion Botulinum toxin A can reduce the calf perimeter effectively,and can reshape calf satisfactorily.

LWvhWyNF.title: The application of mirror shape sesign software in plastic surgery of mandible
LWvhWyNF.abstract: Objective To explore the application advantage of Mirror shape design Software in Plastic Surgery of Mandible. Methods The 95 cases of plastic surgery of mandible were randomized into experimental group and control group,use the mirror shape design Software to make shape design analysis before operation and simulating the postoperative morphology,then measure the data changed. patients in control group underwent operation directly(not using the Mirror shape design Software). Postoperative satisfaction were compared between two groups. ResultsThe satisfaction rate in test group was better than control group,the difference had statistical significance. Conclusion The Mirror shape design software showed good performance in measuring and analyzing patients' morphology and Simulating the postoperative morphology,it is suitable by experiment. The Software gives data to instruct the operation,promoting the intercommunication between doctors and patients,giving quantitative analysis and diagnosis to the appearance of patients. In a word,the Mirror shape design Software can make the plastic surgery more precision and perfect.

qHQAL88F.title: Clinical Therapeutic Effect of Intense Pulse Light Quantum SR for Telangiectasis of Rosacea
qHQAL88F.abstract: 【Objective】 To observe the clinical therapeutic effect of intense pulsed light Quantum SR(IPL Quantum SR) for telangiectasis of rosacea and analysis the possible factors affecting the therapeutic effect.【Methods】 Intense pulse light with the wavelength of 560～1 200 nm was used for treatment of telangiectasis of rosacea non-invasively and the clinical therapeutic effect was observed.And the therapeutic effect of IPL Quantum SR in different course and different times of treatment was compared.【Results】 The total effective rate of IPL Quantum SR was 84.6%.【Conclusion】IPL Quantum SR can therapy the telangiectasis of rosacea effectively.

D4yrhIV6.title: Clinical effect observation of MEBO in wound care after superficial scar with fractional CO_2 laser
D4yrhIV6.abstract: Objective To observe the MEBO use for superficial scar wound care after fractional CO2 laser treated.Methods Patients were randomly divided into two groups,treatment group and control group.Treatment group: superficial scar wound care use for MEBO,and coutrol group use for mupirocin oiument then compared their pain index,wound healing time,Vancouver scar scale and pigmentation incidences.Results The pain index,wound healing time,Vancouver scar scale and pigmentation incidences of treatment group were better than that of control group,P<0.05,there was statistical significance between the two groups.Conclusion Treating superficial scar after fractional CO2 laser with MEBO has advantages such as reducing wound pain,shorter healing time,enhancing therapeutic effect,Reducing the incidence of pigmentation.

r5kwXZYj.title: Changs of skin ultrastructure during wound healing process after treatment of fractional CO_2 laser in mice photoaging model of skin
r5kwXZYj.abstract: Objective To investigate the changes of skin ultrastructure during wound healing process after treatment of fractional CO2 laser in skin photoaging model of mice.Methods The mice skin photoaging model was set up with ultraviolet radiation(UVB) exposure.The skin photoaging model was treated with fractional CO2 laser.The speed and quality of epithelialization were determined with routine histological methods with HE staining and.Electron Microscope Observation of skin ultrastructure on the 1st,3rd,7th and 15th day after the wounding.Results The wound were healed almost in 15th day.On the 1st postoperative day,tissue denaturation and cellular edema were detected around injury point.Mitochondria volume enlarged in fibroblast.The 3rd postoperative day,there were proliferation of fibroblasts,increase in mitochondria and expand of rough endoplasmic reticulum,periodic striation were detected in collagen fibers.The 7th day,the fibroblasts were featured by more active proliferated,mitochondria and RER were abundantly expressed in fibroblasts,collagen fibers increased.The 15th day,the fibroblasts were stable,collagen fibers arranged tight.Conclusion The fractional CO2 laser have well effects on photoaging skin of mice may through affecting on ultrastructures of skin.

2oxNedfp.title: The expression of HIF-1alpha in scars and its relationship to apoptosis]
2oxNedfp.abstract: To explore the mechanism of hypoxic environment lessening in the course of scar maturation.The expression of hypoxia inducible factor 1alpha (HIF-1alpha) and p53 in granulation of burn wound, burn scars of different stages, and normal skin was detected with immunohistochemical staining. The expressions were quantified by the weight method. The relationship between HIF-1alpha and p53 was investigated.With the scar maturation, the expression of HIF-1alpha gradually decreased while the expression of p53 gradually increased within one year. There was a negative correlation between HIF-1alpha and p53 (P < 0.01).p53 plays an important role in scar maturation. Associated with p53, HIF-1alpha may induce apoptosis, which decreases oxygen consumption and lightens hypoxia in the scar maturation.

tKQufZrp.title: Ultrapulse CO_2 fractional laser intervens in situ superficial scar regeneration in a rabbit ear
tKQufZrp.abstract: BACKGROUND:The ultrapulse CO2 fractional laser has a good effect on the treatment of superficial scars, but the mechanism is unclear. OBJECTIVE:To investigate the effect of ultrapulse CO2 fractional laser on the treatment of superficial scars in rabbit ear and to explore mechanism of wound in situ regeneration and repair. METHODS:The superficial scars in rabbit ear were induced with ultrapulse CO2 fractional laser, then traditional iodophor treatment and moist exposed burn ointment treatment methods were used for repairing the wound. RESULTS AND CONCLUSION:The wound healing time of moist exposed burn ointment group was shorter than that of iodophor group (P < 0.01). The epidermal stem cells emerged after the superficial scars induced with ultrapulse CO2 fractional laser, and the expression of cytokeratin 19 and P63 protein was observed after induced for 24 hours. The number of cytokeratin 19 and P63 protein in the moist exposed burn ointment was increased after induced for 4 days and reached peak at 7 days and then decreased at 14 days. While the number of cytokeratin 19 and P63 protein in the iodophor group was increased after induced for 4 days, and then decreased after induced for 7 and 14 days. The expression of cytokeratin 19 and P63 protein in the moist exposed burn ointment group was significantly higher than that in the iodophor group (P < 0.05). Ultrapulse CO2 fractional laser combined with moist exposed burn ointment for the treatment of superficial scar in rabbit ear can better activate and protect the epidermal stem cells, and promote wound repair and in situ regeneration.

0uUyAIOm.title: Application of the orbital septum fat transfer technology in the lower blepharoplasty
0uUyAIOm.abstract: Objective To explore the orbital fat transfer technology in the lower blepharoplasty.Methods Using the orbital septum fat transfer technology in the lower blepharoplasty to fill the canthus,infra-orbital margin,eye-nose groove.Results The 42 cases of lower blepharoplasty all gained satisfying effect.The wrinkles of canthus,the depression of infra-orbital,eye-nose groove obtained improvement and no complications occurred.Conclusion The orbital septum fat transfer technology in the lower blepharoplasty can significantly improve the shape of eyes,and might be widly utilize.

MbBqVAIw.title: Clinical observation of treating scars with variable pulsed Nd:YAG laser and fractional CO_2 laser
MbBqVAIw.abstract: Objective To evaluate the curative effect of the treatment protocol of combination variable pulsed Nd:YAG 532 nm laser treating red scars in inchoate stage and fractional CO2 laser treating superficial scars in late stage.Methods The variable pulsed Nd:YAG 532 nm laser was used to treat inchoate red scars in the face and neck,and the ActiveFX UltraPulse Encore fractional CO2 laser was used to treat late superficial scars.The curative rates were evaluated.Results 90 patients with 98 sites of red scars were involved The sings and symptoms of red scars were relieved afer treatment.The effective rate and curative rate afer treatment for 4 times were 100% and 96% to the strip scar,91% and 70% to the lamellar scar respectively.80 patients with superficial scars were involved.The total curative rate after one time treatment was 65%.Conclusion The treatment protocol of combination variable pulsed Nd:YAG 532 nm laser treating red scars in inchoate stage and fractional CO2 laser treating superficial scars in late stage is effective and worth to popularize.

hfzgsh9k.title: Pulsed dye laser combined with topical imiquimod in refractory PWS Applications
hfzgsh9k.abstract: Objective To evaluate the efficacy of pulsed dye laser(PDL) combined with topical imiquimod in the treatment of refractory fresh(purple,hypertrophic a) erythema mole.Methods The 28 cases in the pulsed dye laser treatment five times the color change is not obvious even to deepen the color of PWS patients were randomly divided into treatment group and control group,the treatment group using the pulsed dye laser treatment topical imiquimod once a day last one month,interval 1.5 months repeated after treatment,after treatment to observe the effect of the control group,continue to use the pulsed dye laser treatment twice after the observed effects.Results The pulsed dye laser in combination with topical imiquimod treatment effect was significantly better than the original single pulsed dye laser treatment effect.Conclusion based on the results of this preliminary study,the pulsed dye laser and imiquimod treatment of refractory port wine stains have a good prospect for clinical application.

ncNtzwr6.title: The Value of MR Perfusion Imaging in Differentiating Atypical Hepatic Abscess
ncNtzwr6.abstract: Objective To evaluate the diagnostic value of MR perfusion imaging in atypical hepatic Abscess .Methods MRI data of 8 cases with atypical hepatic Abscess proved by pathology and follow-up after clinical therapy were retrospectively analyzed . Results The atypical hepatic Abscess appeared almostly as the uneven slightly signal intensity on T1WI and the uneven slightly high signal intensity on T2WI , the time signal curve appeared as the type of quickly rise or slowly rise . Conclusion Most of the atypical hepatic Abscess is early hepatic Abscess,MRI showed nonspecific features,in combination with MR perfusion weighted imaging can improve the diagnosis and differential diagnosis of the atypical hepatic Abscess .

dtOLTwq2.title: Value of MRI in Preoperative Evaluation of Knee Joint Meniscus Injury
dtOLTwq2.abstract: Objective:To study the value of MRI in preoperative evaluation of the knee joint meniscus injury. Methods:40 cases of meniscus injury were confirmed by operation performance,and the MRI features were retrospectively analyzed.Results:The rate of accuracy,sensitivity,and specificity of MRI for meniscal tear was 88.7%,83.0%,97%.Conclusion:As a non-invasive examination methods,MRI is the best way to check the knee meniscus injury in preoperative evaluation.

pGQK6jvV.title: A Preliminary Study on Magnetic Resonance Diffusion Imaging of Normal Canine Spinal Cord
pGQK6jvV.abstract: Objective To explore the feasibility,technical features and research significance of magnetic resonance diffusion-weighted imaging(DWI)of normal canine spinal cord.Methods Eight beagle dogs were anesthetized with Sumianxin,then their spinal cord diffusion imaging was performed immediately.Siemens sonata1.5T MRI System was used to scan with different parameters on the basis of echo-planar imaging(EPI).The image characteristics was analyzed and compared among these dogs,and their average apparent diffusion coefficient(ADC)was calculated.Results With 3mm of slice thickness,singly stimulated SE-EPI diffusion sequence obtained a better cervical spinal cord DWI.Cervical spinal cord had obvious anisotropy,diffusion gradient parallel to the white matter fiber received a higher ADC value.The average ADC value of the cervical spinal cord sagittal imaging was(109.6±6.8)×10-3 mm2/s.Conclusions 1.5T MRI system can scan magnetic resonance diffusion-weighted imaging(DWI) of canine cervical spinal cord.Exploring the characteristics of the normal canine spinal cord imaging can guide canine spinal cord tests.

JuTsgr3W.title: Diffusion weighted imaging in cirrhotic liver and correlation study with pathologic findings
JuTsgr3W.abstract: Objective To investigate the change and mechanism of ADC value in cirrhotic liver and its pathological basis. Methods Diffusion weighted imaging was performed in 12 normal liver and 11 patients with pathologically proved liver cirrhosis, and the ADC values of the liver were measured. The b values were 0, 50, 1000 s/mm2. The ADC_1 and ADC_2 were calculated with different b values. The findings were compared with pathology. Results The mean ADC_1, ADC_2 in cirrhotic liver was significantly lower than that in normal liver. The main histopathological changes were fibrous tissue proliferation, distortion of lobules and pseudolobular formation. Conclusion The main causes of decreased ADC value in cirrhotic liver were: ①the fibrous tissue in the liver limited the movement of water, ②the blood perfusion in the liver decreased.

5vw7dwnM.title: Diagnostic value of MR imaging for parathyroid adenoma
5vw7dwnM.abstract: Objective To investigate the MRI findings of parathyroid adenoma and to evaluate their significance in the qualitative and localized diagnosis together with review of the literature.Methods Five patients(3 men,2 women;aged 21-39 years)with surgically and pathologically proved parathyroid adenoma underwent MR imaging of the parathyroid glands before the operation.All procedures were performed by using a SIEMENS sonata 1.5 T superconductive MR system.Results All lesions of parathyriod adenoma in 5 patients were located in the esophagotracheal resses of thyroid inferiority.The lesions in 4 cases were slightly hypointense signals on T1WI and hyperintense signals on T2WI.In the remaining one case,the lesion was heterogeneous intensity associated with partial necrosis which was cofirmed by pathology.On MR images,the border of lesions was clear and their size ranged from 1.2×1.0×1.6(cm)to 2.2×3.1×4.1(cm).Conclusion MR imaging can accurately reveal the size,shape,location of parathyroid adenoma and its relationship with neighbor tissue structures,thus it is effective means for diagnosing parathyroid adenoma and planning its treatment protocol.

KPc6R4TJ.title: Clinic Value of Diffusion Weighted and Perfusion Weighted MR Imaging in Focal Hepatic Lesions
KPc6R4TJ.abstract: Objective To explore the value of diffusion weighted and perfusion weighted magnetic resonance imaging in differential diagnosis of focal liver lesions.Methods Diffusion weighted MR imaging and measurement of apparent diffusion coeffient (ADC value) were performed in 127 patients with 209 local hepatic lesions(including hepatic cyst 69,hemangioma 57,hepatic carcinoma 36,metastasis 47) .And ADC values were calculated.The b values were 0、500 s/mm2.PWI was performed in patients including carcinoma 15 ,hemangioma 8 ,hepatic cyst 2.Results The average ADC value of malignant masses(hepatic carcinomas and metastasis) was significantly different from that of hepatic cysts and hemangiomas.1.71×10-3 mm2/s as interface of the benign and malignant liver lesions,the specificity was 86.5%,the sensitivity 97.5%.TSCs of most carcinoma showed quick rising and falling and all TSCs of hemangioma showed slow rising and quick falling.Conclusion DWI and PWI are accurate approaches in differential diagnosis of liver lesions,which can also be accepted as a new sequence in the characterization of focal liver lesions.

p0TJoCNT.title: Synthesis, characterization, and anti-cancer activity of emodin-Mn(II) metal complex.
p0TJoCNT.abstract: To synthesize and characterize a novel metal complex of Mn (II) with emodin, and evaluate its anti-cancer activity. The elemental analyses, IR, UV-vis, atomic absorption spectroscopy, TG-DSC, (1)H NMR, and (13)C NMR data were used to characterize the structure of the complex. The cytotoxicity of the complex against the human cancer cell lines HepG2, HeLa, MCF-7, B16, and MDA-MB-231 was tested by the MTT assay and flow cytometry. Emodin was coordinated with Mn(II) through the 9-C=O and 1-OH, and the general formula of the complex was Mn(II) (emodin)2·2H2O. In studies of the cytotoxicity, the complex exhibited significant activity, and the IC50 values of the complex against five cancer cell lines improved approximately three-fold compared with those of emodin. The complex could induce cell morphological changes, decrease the percentage of viability, and induce G0/G1 phase arrest and apoptosis in cancer cells. The coordination of emodin with Mn(II) can improve its anticancer activity, and the complex Mn(II) (emodin)2·2H2O could be studied further as a promising anticancer drug.

L4asyStW.title: Antioxidant activities of aqueous extract from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb and its fractions.
L4asyStW.abstract: Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb is used as the tonic for asthenia and fatigue in China. Considering that the energizing effect might be correlated with antioxidant properties, we investigated the antioxidant activities of aqueous extract (AE) from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb by assessing radical-scavenging and anti-lipid-peroxidation abilities. We found that AE shows a moderate antioxidant activity to scavenge DPPH*, O2(-)* and *OH and inhibit beta-carotene bleaching with IC(50) values of 13.0, 33.2, 351, and 11.9 microg/ml, respectively, while its AcOEt-soluble fraction (ESF) and BuOH soluble fraction (BSF) exhibit remarkable efficiencies. The ESF's IC(50) values of scavenging DPPH*, O2(-)*, and *OH, and inhibiting beta-carotene bleaching are 5.6, 5.8, 171, and 7.6 mircog/ml, respectively, and those of BSF are 7.5, 8.4, 82.0, and 6.2 microg/ml, respectively. In addition, we found that there is a significant correlation between total phenol content and the antioxidant activity determined by O2(-)* and *OH scavenging, and beta-carotene-bleaching assays. Furthermore, HPLC analysis revealed the presence of quercetin, hyperoside, quercitrin, taxifoliol, luteolin-7-O-beta-D-glucopyranoside, and rutin in Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb. Thus, we suggest that the extracts from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb, could be considered as natural antioxidant sources and dietary nutritional supplements to prevent oxidation-related diseases.

j26NwcUV.title: Application of quantum dots in drug discovery
j26NwcUV.abstract: Because of excellent optical properties, quantum dots (QDs) have gained some meaningful progress in biomedical research and application, and have caught great interests of researchers who are engaged in drug discovery. In this paper, we mainly reviewed the characteristics of quantum and its potential applications in drug delivery, drug screening and drug target identification. Furthermore, the problems and limitations of quantum dots in drug discovery, such as biocompatibility, bioconjugation and biotoxicity, were analyzed and discussed.

oCJ54SFb.title: The DNA-binding and bioactivity of rare earth metal complexes.
oCJ54SFb.abstract: Recently more and more attention is paid to the rare earth metal complexes, because the properties of the rare earth metals are similar to those of the transition metals such as the similar atomic and the ionic radius. A large number of rare metal complexes were synthesized, and their bioactivities were also studied. This review highlights recent researches on the interaction of some rare earth metal complexes with DNA, analyzes how the configuration of the complexes influences the binding affinity, and focuses on the pharmacological activities of the complexes, such as anticancer, antibacterial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory and anti-virus.

WjOMS4Rf.title: Quantitative Analysis of Flavones in the Ginkgo Biloba Extract by High Performance Liquid Chromatography
WjOMS4Rf.abstract: Ginkgo Biloba Extract(EGB) has shown that multiple bioactivity and flavones are recognized as main active substance.It is essential that a efficiency and economical quantitative method for flavones in EGB is set up.The aim of the authors is to develop a high performance liquid chromatography method for the quantitative analysis of flavones in the Ginkgo Biloba Extract(EGB) applying Shiseido NANONSPACE SI-2 high performance liquid chromatography system.The analytical column is Capcell Pak C18 column(1.5 mm×250 mm,5 μm).The mobile phase consisted of 0.5% phosphate buffer/methanol(48∶52) previously filtered.Flow rate was 200 μL/min and UV detection is set up at(360 nm).Injection volume is 1 μL.Under this high performance liquid chromatography condition,there is a good separation for quercetin.kaempferol and isorhamnetin.And the method had excellent stability and reliability.There is a good linear relationships(r=0.999 8) between peak area and concentration(C) within the range of 40~200 μg/mL for quercetin.The average analytical recovery of quercetin is 99.2%.

sDpnD7cq.title: Hydrolytic cleavage of DNA by quercetin manganese(II) complexes.
sDpnD7cq.abstract: Quercetin manganese(II) complexes were investigated focusing on its DNA hydrolytic activity. The complexes successfully promote the cleavage of plasmid DNA, producing single and double DNA strand breaks. The amount of conversion of supercoiled form (SC) of plasmid DNA to the nicked circular form (NC) depends on the concentration of the complex as well as the duration of incubation of the complexes with DNA. The maximum rate of conversion of the supercoiled form to the nicked circular form at pH 7.2 in the presence of 100 microM of the complexes is found to be 1.32 x 10(-4) s(-1). The hydrolytic cleavage of DNA by the complexes was supported by the evidence from free radical quenching, thiobarbituric acid-reactive substances (TBARS) assay and T4 ligase ligation.

euo4ZeTA.abstract: Flavonoids exist in many kinds of plants and have many pharmacological activities.It can act as metallic chelator due to its peculiar structure.The chelate rule and pharmacological activities of anticancer and antioxidant of flavonoids-metal complexes are reviewed.Meanwhile,quantum chemistrion calculation for flavonoids-metal complexes is introduced to forecast the possible experimental results and the future tendency of these complexes is predicted.

a0zeoG4S.title: In-vitro Antitumor Activity and Antifungal Activity of Pennogenin Steroidal Saponins from paris Polyphylla var. yunnanensis.
a0zeoG4S.abstract: Paris polyphylla Smith var. yunnanensis, has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for its antibiotic and anti-inflammatory properties; in addition it has been used to cure liver cancer in particular. In this current study, β-ecdysterone (1) and three pennogenin steroidal saponins (2-4) were isolated from the EtOH extract of Paris polyphylla var. yunnanensis, and then tested for their antitumor and antifungal activities. Spectroscopic data was used to confirm their structures. Their antitumor properties were determined by using an MTT assay in addition to ethidium bromide and acridine orange staining techniques. Compounds 2, 3 and 4 exhibited significant anti-proliferation activities against HepG2 cells, with IC50 values of 13.5 μM, 9.7 μM and 11.6 μM respectively, obtained following 48 h treatment. Furthermore, we found these pennogenin steroidal saponins could induce HepG2 cells apoptosis at a concentration of 20 μM after 48 h treatment. Compounds 2, 3 and 4 were confirmed to exhibit moderate antifungal activity. The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of compounds 2, 3 and 4 against saccharomyces cerevisiae hansen were 2.5 mg.mL(-1), 0.6 mg.mL(-1) and 0.6 mg.mL(-1), respectively. The MIC of compounds 2, 3 and 4 against Candida albicans were 1.2 mgmL(-1), 0.6 mg.mL(-1) and 1.2 mg.mL(-1), respectively. The analysis of the bioactivity-structure relationship shows that the sugar moiety plays a critical role in the activity of steroid moiety. Our results suggest that these three pennogenin steroidal saponins could be utilized to develop anticancer medicines.

9yHsHKgG.title: Survivin and Bcl-2 modulate apoptosis in A549 cell induced by quercetin
9yHsHKgG.abstract: Aim: To investigate the apoptosis of lung cancer cells A549 induced by quercetin and the regulation of survivin and Bcl-2 on A549 cells induced by quercetin. Methods: MTT, fluorescence stain, flow cytometric analysis and immunocytochemistry stain were carried out. Results: Quercetin had a significant inhibition on growth and proliferation of A549 cell in a concentration-and time-dependent manner. Evidence was provided that apoptosis occurred in A549 cells treated with quercetin using fluorescence microscopy. Quercetin arrested A549 cells at the G 0/G 1 phase by FCM analyses. Expression of survivin and Bcl-2 protein were decreased, and activity of caspase-3 were enhanced. Conclusion: Quercetin could induce apoptosis of A549 cells. The arrested cell cycle and the down-regulation of survivin and Bcl-2 protein could activate caspase-3 resulting in cells apoptosis, which may contribute to the apoptosis mechanisms. The down-regulated survivin and Bcl-2 may play an important role in A549 cells apoptosis induced by quercetin.

c76cvk7m.title: Effect of Ginkgo biloba extract and ginsenosides on the Vascular Activity Substance production in endothelium cells
c76cvk7m.abstract: Though Ginkgo biloba extract(GBE)and ginsennosides(GS)also have notability bioactivity on cardiovascular disease,there is little literature about applying the compound of them to treat cardiovascular disease.After endothelium cells suffering from oxidative injury were treated with serum containing GBE,GS and the compound of them(GG),respectively,production of NO,ET and MDA in them was observed by applying serum pharmacology.Both GBE and GS up-regulate NO level and down-regulate ET-1 and MDA level in endothelium cells suffering from oxidative injury.Anti-oxidation activity increased after GBE and GS were combined.But the NO up-regulation of GG was inferior to that of GBE and GS,which decreased by 29.9% and 66.7% when compared with that of GBE and GS,respectively.The ET-1 down-regulation of GG was superior to that of GBE, but decreased by 11.6% compared with that of GS.The compatibility of GBE and GS do not show synergic effect on NO and ET-1 regulation in endothelium cells and it is valuable to discuss that the compound of GBE and GS is used to treat cardiovascular diseases.

EpLnIycr.title: Promoting effect of triterpenoid compound from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb on preadipocytes differentiation via up-regulation of PPARγ expression.
EpLnIycr.abstract: Agrimonia Pilosa Ledeb (APL), a traditional Chinese medicine, has been reported a variety of biological activities, including treating T2DM.Triterpenoid compound (TC) was collected from APL. The aim of this study was to investigate the effects of TC on 3T3-L1 preadipocytes differentiation and genes related to differentiation and IR.Column chromatography was used to collect TC from ALP. 3T3-L1 cell differentiation was induced typically in the presence of various concentrations of TC or pioglitazone. Oil red O staining and measurement of intracellular TG content were performed on the seventh day of differentiation. Then quantitative polymerase chain reaction (Q-PCR) was used to test the expressions of three transcription factors (PPARγ, CCAAT enhancer binding protein-α (C/EBP-α), and sterol regulatory element-binding protein 1 (SREBP-1)) and the target genes of PPARγ including glucose transporter (GLUT4), lipoprotein lipase (LPL), fat acid binding protein (AP2), and adiponectin in 3T3-L1 cells.At the concentration of 5, 25 and 125 μg/mL, TC significantly promoted triglyceride accumulation. Further study showed that TC could promote the expression of PPARγ, C/EBPα and ADD1/SREBP1 significantly at 125 μg/mL. As for downstream genes controlled by PPARγ, TC at 25 and 125 μg/mL could significantly promote the expression of GLUT4 and adiponectin. However, the expression of aP2 related to lipid metabolism and adiposity in the TC group was significantly lower than that in the pioglitazone group.TC could promote preadipocytes differentiation through activating PPARγ and downstream controlled genes. TC has the ideal insulin sensitization with lower adipogenic action than classical TZDs in vitro. So TC from Agrimonia Pilosa Ledeb has a good prospect as a natural drug for IR and T2DM.

MVjMW9E9.title: Hydrolytic cleavage of DNA by quercetin zinc(II) complex.
MVjMW9E9.abstract: Quercetin zinc(II) complex was investigated focusing on its hydrolytic activity toward DNA. The complex successfully promotes the cleavage of plasmid DNA, producing single and double DNA strand breaks. The amount of conversion of supercoiled form (SC) of plasmid to the nicked circular form (NC) depends on the concentration of the complex as well as the duration of incubation of the complex with DNA. The rate of conversion of SC to NC is 1.68x10(-4) s(-1) at pH 7.2 in the presence of 100 microM of the complex. The hydrolytic cleavage of DNA by the complex is supported by the evidence from free radical quenching, thiobarbituric acid-reactive substances (TBARS) assay, and T4 ligase ligation.

59R2BCgG.title: Carboxyl-terminal and Arg38 are essential for activity of the 7α-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase from Clostridium absonum.
59R2BCgG.abstract: 7α-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase (7α-HSDH, EC 1.1.1.159), one of the short-chain dehydrogenase/reductase superfamily, catalyzes the dehydrogenation of C7 hydroxyl group of the steroid skeleton of bile acids. Clostridium absonum 7α-HSDH (Ca 7α-HSDH) was cloned and heterologously expressed in Escherichia coli. The function of carboxyterminal (C-terminal) and Arg38 of Ca 7α-HSDH was investigated through truncations and site-directed mutagenesis, respectively. When 2 and 6 amino acids of C-terminal were removed, the catalytic efficiency (k(cat)/K(m)) of Ca 7α-HSDH remained 19.1% and 2.5%, respectively. Furthermore, the activity could not be detected after 8, 14 and 17 amino acids were deleted. No activity could be detected with coenzyme either NADP(+) or NAD(+) after replacement of arginine at position 38 by aspartic acid. The metal ions Mg(2+) (50 mM), Na(+) (200 mM) and K(+) (500 mM) could maximally improve the activity of Ca 7α-HSDH by 61.4%, 64.7% and 105.7%, respectively. The activity had no significant change after incubation at 4 or 25 °C for 108 h, but decreased dramatically at 37 °C. Our study confirmed that C-terminal and Arg38 were essential for the catalytic function of Ca 7α-HSDH and the enzyme activity can be improved by metal ions.

kEohESNr.title: Regulation of Survivin in Apoptosis of SMMC7721 Cells Induced by Quercetin
kEohESNr.abstract: Objective To investigate the apoptosis of SMMC7721 hepatic cancer cells induced by quercetin and its relationship with the expression of survivin and activity of caspase-3.Methods Inhibitory effect of quercetin on SMMC7721 cells was detected by MTT assay.Morphological changes of apoptotic cells for Hoechst staining were observed by fluorescence microscope.Cell cycle was analyzed by flow cytometry(FCM).Expression of survivin protein was detected by immunocytochemistry staining.Activity of caspase-3 was analyzed by colorimetry.Results Quercetin had a significant inhibition on growth and proliferation of SMMC7721 cells in a concentration-and time-dependent manner.The IC50 was 84.24 μmol·L-1 after cells were treated with quercetin for 48h.evidence was provided that apoptosis occurred in SMMC7721 cells treated with quercetin using fluorescence microscope.It was suggested that quercetin blocked SMMC7721 cells at the G0/G1 phase by FCM analysis.Expression of survivin protein was decreased,and activity of caspase-3 were enhanced.Conclusion Quercetin could induce apoptosis of SMMC7721 cells by down-regcclating the expression of survivin protein and actionting caspase-3.

ZbFsBCRp.title: Influence of adenosine preconditioning on NGF and BDNF in OGD astrocyte
ZbFsBCRp.abstract: Objective To explore the effect of adenosine preconditioning on NGF and BDNF in OGD astrocyte.Methods Astrocytes of pallium in SD rat were cultured in vitro.The third or fourth generation of astrocytes was passaged to 96 pore plate.After adherence and evection,they were divided into three groups randomly: normal control group,OGD group and ADO group.The shape of astrocyte and concentration of NGF and BDNF in cell culture fluid were observed at the time of 8 hours after OGD and 24 hours after reoxygenation.Results The vitality of NGF and BDNF in OGD group were obviously higher than that in normal control group(P<0.05).The vitality of NGF and BDNF in ADO group and OGD group were obviously higher(P<0.01).There were statistical significances in the concentration of NGF and BDNF in cell medium in three groups(P<0.01 or P<0.05).Conclusion The expressions of NGF and BDNF in astrocyte are higher after OGD.Adenosine preconditioning could increase the expression of NGF and BDNF after OGD.The up-regulation of NGF and BDNF expressions may be one of the molecular mechanism in cerebral ischemia tolerance induced adenosine preconditioning and neural protection.

DyB7ujRg.title: Effects of learning and memory training on the cognitive ability of rat with global cerebral ischemia
DyB7ujRg.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of Y-type maze training on the learning and memory abilities and the expression level of brain-derived-neurotrophic factor(BDNF) in hippocampus CA1 region of rats with global cerebral ischemia.Methods Ninety male SD rats were selected and randomly divided into three groups: sham-operated group(n=30),control group(n=30) and training group(n=30).The rat model of global cerebral ischemia was made by a modified Pulsinelli's 4-vessel occlusion(4-VO) method.The rats were trained for twenty-one days by Y-type maze after operation 1 week.The difference of spatial learning and memory rats was compared by Y-type maze.Hematoxylin-Eosin staining was applied to observe the morphological characteristics of neurons in CA1 region.The expression level of BDNF in hippocampus CA1 region was tested by immunhistochemical method.Results After training for 21 days,the total reaction time and latent period in control group were significantly longer than those in training group and sham-operated group(P<0.05),however,the error number significantly increased(P<0.05).After training for 21 days,the expression level of BDNF in training group was higher than that in control group.Conclusion The training of Y-type maze can significantly improve the learning and memory abilities of rats with global cerebral ischemia,which is probably concerned with increasing the expression level of BDNF in hippocampus CA1 region.

vHuyKny9.title: Curative effect on soft channel and hard channel of minimally invasive treatment for hypertensive intra cerebral hemorrhage
vHuyKny9.abstract: Objective To analyze the curative effect on soft channel and hard channel treatment for hypertensive intra cerebral hemorrhage(HICH).Methods Eighty-four patients with definite HICH were admitted into this department during Oct.2007 to Oct.2011.The patients were randomly divided into two groups:observation group and treatment group,each group had 42 cases.The observation group were given soft channel minimally invasive installed tube aspiration and the treatment group were given hard channel microinvasive craniopuncture aspiration technique of intracranial hematoma.The effect and activities of daily living(ADL)scores of 3 months after treatment in the two groups were compared.Results The total effective rate in the observation group was 92.9%,which was 90.5% in treatment group.There was no significant difference between the two groups(P>0.05).After treatment of 3 months,there was no significant difference of ADL scores between the two groups(P>0.05).Conclusion Both soft channel and hard channel minimally invasive treatment have significant curative effect in treatment of patients with HICH.

rCM3A9K9.title: Impact of puerarin preconditioning on apoptosis and expression of p53 in focal cerebral ischemia reperfusion injury rats
rCM3A9K9.abstract: Objective To observe the expression of P53 protein and apoptosis cells in hippocampus of rats with cerebral ischemia after the pretreatment with puerarin and the effect of pretreatment with puerarin and explain the cerebral ischemia tollerating mechanism that was induced by pretreatment of puerarin.Methods The models of focal cerebral ischemia reperfusion injury by middle cerebral artery occlusion(MCAO)was established in SD rats.SD rats(n=72)were randomly divided into three groups each consisted of 24 rats.S group was only exposed anatomically without cerebral ischemia and reperfusion.IR group was cerebral ischemia-reperfusion through abdomenal injection of normal saline.P group was cerebral ischemia and reperfusion given puerarin through abdomenal injection.The rats in every group were again divided into three subgroups each group consisted of 8 rats.The expression of p53 protein in hippocampus was detected by immunhistochemical method.Apoptosis cell in hippocampus was determined by terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase-mediated dUTP nick end labeling(TUNEL).Results In P2h group the expression level of p53 protein was increased 2 hours after reperfusion,the level of p53 was significantly increased in P24h group and decreased in P72h group after reperfusion,but still significantly lower than that of IR group(P<0.01).The number of apoptosis cells in P2h,P24h and P72h groups was significantly lower than that of IR2h,IR24h and IR72h group,respectively(P<0.01).Conclusion The down-regulation of expression of p53 protein may be one of mechanisms of cerebral protective effect due to use of puerarin.Puerarin is assooicated with the ocurrence of delayed neuron death.

olsNGRAK.title: Impact of glutamine on expression of Occludin in intestinal mucosal tissue from acute global cerebral ischemia-reperfusion injury rats
olsNGRAK.abstract: Aim:To study the impact of glutamine on the expression of Occludin in the intestinal mucosal tissue from the acute global cerebral ischemia-reperfusion(GCIR)injury rats.Methods:The global brain ischemia rat model was established through the four-vessel occlusion method.The rats were divided into four groups:the sham operation group(control group),the saline group,the ozagrel group and the glutamine group.The latter 3 groups were established GCIR model.The saline group was given the same volume normal saline time after reperfusion;the ozagrel group was given the same volume normal saline in which ozagrel 33.67 mg/kg was dissolved at the same time;the glutamine group was given the same volume normal saline in which ozagrel 33.67 mg/kg and 20%glutamine 0.4 g/kg were dissolved respectively.The time of observation was 6,12,24 h after reperfusion.After that,every experimental animal was killed,and brain and intestine were obtained to investigate the pathological changes of the neurons in the hippocampus with the HE staining and the expression of Occludin in the intestinal mucosa with the immunohistochemistry.Results:At 6,12,24 h after reperfusion,the struceture of hippocampus cells were disordered and the bondaries of them were indistinct in the saline group,the ozagrel group and the glutamine group.The expression of Occludin protein has significant difference among the 4 gorups at 12,24 h(H=15.175,20.234,P<0.001).The expression of Occludin in the saline group,the ozagrel group and the glutamine group decreased than that in the sham operation group;the expression of Occludin in the glutamine group was higher than those in the saline group and the ozagrel group(P<0.05).Conclusion:Glutamine can protect the intestinal mucosal barrier in the acute global cerebral ischemia-reperfusion injury in rats against the decrease of the expression of Occludin.

L8Q0feRA.title: Influence of adenosine preconditioning on glial cell-derived neurotrophic factor in oxygen-glucose deprivation astrocyte
L8Q0feRA.abstract: Objective To explore the effect of adenosine preconditioning on glial cell-derived neurotrophic factor(GDNF)in oxygen-glucose deprivation astrocyte.Methods Astrocytes of pallium in SD rats were cultured in vitro,the third or fourth generation of astrocytes were passaged to 96 pore plate.After adherence and evection,they were divided into normal control group,oxygen-glucose deprivation group and adenosine preconditioning group randomly.The shape of astrocytes were observed and contents of GDNF in cell culture fluid were detected at the time of 8 hours after oxygen-glucose deprivation and 24 hours after reoxygenation.Results The levels of GDNF in oxygen-glucose deprivation group were obviously higher than those in normal control group(P<0.05).The levels of GDNF in adenosine preconditioning group were obviously higher than those in oxygen-glucose deprivation group(P<0.05).Conclusion Adenosine preconditioning can increase the expression of GDNF after oxygen-glucose deprivation.The up regulation of GDNF expression may be one of the molecular mechanism in cerebral ischemia tolerance induced by adenosine preconditioning and neural protection.
