cjgYDocF.title: Research Progress of Emulsion Adhesives
cjgYDocF.abstract: The recent research progress in emulsion adhesives is reviewed.Many methods are used to improve properties and performance of emulsion adhesives,including changing proportion of monomers or initiator system,improving emulsion polymerization,mixing or chemical combination with other polymers.The future development tendency and application of emulsion adhesives are previewed.

UcnbsetK.title: Preparation of dimethyldichlorosilane by redistributing methyltri-chlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane with AlCl_3 supported catalysts
UcnbsetK.abstract: Several AlCl_3 supported catalysts were prepared and used in the redistribution reaction of methyltrichlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane to produce dimethyldichlorosilane.The features of the catalysts were investigated.Also L_(16)(4~5) orthogonal experiments were carried out to study the effects of reaction temperature,reaction time,catalyst quantity and mol ratio of reaction materials on the yield of dimethyldichlorosilane.The results show that the most predominated factors for the yield are reaction temperature and catalyst quantity.Under the optimum reaction conditions,the yield of dimethyldichlorosilane can reach to 60.6%.

S3OvpFft.title: Study on Redistribution of Methyltrichlorosilane and Trimethylchlorosilane over AlCl_3 Supported Catalyst
S3OvpFft.abstract: Several AlCl_3 supported catalysts were prepared and used in redistribution of methyl- trichlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane,which byproduct were produced from the direct synthesis of dimethyl-dichlorosilane,and dimethyldichlorosilane.The activity of catalysts were investigated in the fixed-bed reactor(length 800 mm,ID 30 mm).The test results showed that AlCl_3 supported on activated carbon catalyst was best in yield of 70%.Optimum reaction conditions of redistribution were determined,in which the molor ratio of reactants was 1.0,LHSV was 0.66 mL/(h·g-cat), reaction temperature was 320℃.The stability of the AlCl_3 supported on activated carbon catalyst was good within 100 h.

IOVsnFfk.title: Properties of Phenolic Molding Compounds Reinforced with Sisal Fiber
IOVsnFfk.abstract: Phenolic molding compounds were reinforced with sisal fiber(SF).Influences of surface treatments on SF,and content of SF on the properties of phenolic molding compounds were studied.The reinforcement of SF on phenolic molding compounds was also compared with glass fiber(GF) and the traditional filler such as wood powder.The results show that the properties of phenolic molding compounds can be improved significantly by incorporation of SF compared with wood powder,and exhibit higher impact strength than GF.Content of SF in phenolic molding compounds has great influence on its mechanical,heat and water resistant properties.SEM analysis reveals that the interaction between SF and matrix resin is improved obviously after SF is treated by alkali-thermal and silane coupling agent and thus enhances the surface adhesion between the SF and matrix.

82Lw9Ogg.title: Organize modification of silica sol and its application in adhesives
82Lw9Ogg.abstract: Hydrophilic silica sol was organize modified by silane coupling agents(SCA) through solvent-phase-transfer method.Compared with 3-glycidylpropyl-trimethyloxyl silane(KH560)and 3-(methacryloxypropyl)-trimethoxy silane(KH570),nano silica particles modified by long-chain polyether type SCA showed a better performance in dispersion in organic matrix,both epoxy resin and acrylic ester and formed better flexible interface,thus adhesive strength was dramatically increased.

8Mw4eBv8.title: Development of Comprehensive Utilization by Redistribution and Convertion of Methyltrichlorosilane
8Mw4eBv8.abstract: As the main byproduct in the direct process of synthesizing dimethyldichlorosilane,scale disposal and comprehensive utilization of methyltrichlorosilane by reasonable way was key to realize sustainable development of organsilicone industry.In this paper,research progress on disproporation and convertion technology of methyltrichlorosilane were introduced.The disproporation technics include the reaction of methyltrichlorosilane with trimethylchlorosilane,methyltrichlorosilane with high boiling and low boiling residues.The methyl(hydro) aluminumchloride,hydrogenation and chlorination methods were involved in the convertion of methyltrichlorosilane.Also the features of the above methods and processes were reviewed.The future industrial development tendency on fully convertion and utilization of methyltrichlorosilane were previewed.

hKMvP69x.title: Activated carbon supported AlCl_3 solid acid catalyst:structural characterization and catalytic properties for redistribution reaction of methylchlorosilane
hKMvP69x.abstract: Methyltrichlorosilane(M_1) and trimethylchlorosilane(M_3) are usually produced as byproducts in the direct synthesis process of dimethyldichlorosilane.The two chemicals could be converted into more valuable dimethyldichlorosilane through the redistribution technology.By using activated carbon as support, environmentally benign activated carbon supported AlCl_ 3 solid acid catalysts were prepared by the impregnation-evaporation-calcination method.The effects of acid-treatment conditions, AlCl_ 3 loading and activation(calcination)temperature on the catalytic activity were examined for the redistribution reaction of methyltrichlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane in a 20 mm×800 mm fixed bed reactor under conditions of 310℃,n(M_1/M_3)=1.0 and LHSV=1.5 h~ -1 , and the stability of catalytic activity was investigated also.The structure and surface properties of catalysts were characterized with BET, XRD, TG-DSC and pyridine-adsorbed Raman spectroscopy.The results revealed that it would be better if the activated carbon was treated by hydrochloric acid of 2.0 mol·L~ -1 for 6 h,and suitable conditions for AlCl_ 3 loading and calcination temperature were 1.87 mmol·g~ -1 and 450—500℃ respectively.The stability of the activated carbon supported AlCl_3 catalyst was good for at least 100 h.The XRD and TG-DSC results indicated that AlCl_ 3 would no longer exist in the form of AlCl_ 3 crystal after it was supported on activated carbon and activated.The TG-DSC analysis showed that further heating of the catalyst at 485—600℃ resulted in decomposition and removal of active component from the catalyst surface.The pyridine-adsorbed Raman spectroscopy revealed that the active component of the catalyst behaved as Lewis acid.

YBksMSoc.title: Study on Redistribution of Methyltrichlorosilane and Low-boiling Residues Using Activated Carbon Supported AlCl_3 Catalysts
YBksMSoc.abstract: Methyltrichlorosilane and low-boiling residues are byproducts in the direct synthesis process of dimethyldichlorosilane, and these two byproducts can be converted into more valuable methylchlorosilanes through redistribution technologies. In the experiments, the supported AlCl3 catalysts used for the redistribution reaction of methyltrichlorosilane and low-boiling residues in a fixed bed reactor to produce dimethyldichlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane were prepared by using an impregnation-evaporation-alcination method. The pretreatment methods of activated carbon (AC), which is used as the catalyst support, and the reaction conditions affecting the redistribution reaction were experimentally investigated. It is found that the AlCl3 catalyst supported on the AC pretreated by high temperature will have a higher activity for the redistribution reaction. It is due to the high temperature pretreatment will enlarge the pore size of the AC and will increase its specific surface area. The optimum reaction conditions for the redistribution reaction were determined as follows: the mass ratio of methyltrichlorosilane to low-boiling residues is 2.0~3.0, the reaction temperature 310℃ and LHSV 1.5h?1. The AC supported AlCl3 catalyst requires only a mild reaction conditions and it shows a good catalytic stability in the redistribution reaction.

WkFJwRz3.title: Conversion of methyltrichlorosilane in stirred bed reactor by methylalumminumchloride method
WkFJwRz3.abstract: This paper focuses on the reaction technique of converting methyltrichlorosilane, the main byproduct in the direct synthesis of dimethyldichlorosilane, to more valuable methylchlorosilanes. The conversion reaction of methyltrichlorosilane in a stirred bed reactor by the methylaluminumchloride method with aluminum powder and methylchloride as raw materials was systematically investigated. It was found that after an introduction period of about 100 min, the reaction reached a steady state with good activity in the absence of catalysts by the aid of mechanical stirring in the reactor which promoted the elimination of oxidized layer on the surface of the aluminum powder and speeded up the surface renewal process. Increasing the stirring speed and raising the reaction temperature to the optimum levels were favorable to the conversion reaction. The molar proportion of methyl chloride to methyltricholrosilane (m) in the feed had great effect on the reaction conversion and product composition. The concentrations of dimethyldichlorosilane and trimethylchlorosilane in the product were relatively higher while the reaction conversion of methyltrichlorosilane was lower when m<2.0, the trimethylchlorosilane was the main conversion product when m=2.0, and tetramethylsilane became the main product at a higher reaction conversion of methyltrichlorosilane when m>2.0. The reaction mechanism was discussed by analysing the SEM surface morphology of the aluminum powder before and after reaction.

DX6KRcyf.title: The Curing Kinetics and Thermal Properties of Epoxy Resin E-51 Modified by Amino Silsesquioxane
DX6KRcyf.abstract: Amino silsesquioxane was prepared by the reaction of chloromethyl silsesquioxane(CM-POSS) and ethylenediamine,and it was characterized with infrared spectrum(FT-IR).The curing kinetics of amino silsesquioxane(POSS-NH2)/epoxy resin(E-51)/diaminodiphenl sulfone(DDS) and E-51 system were studied by means of differential scanning calorimetry(DSC),and thermal properties of two systems were researched by TGA.The results indicated that hybrid resin had more activation energy and the thermal properties of the cured hybrid resin were improved with increasing of the content of POSS-NH2.

tkq59vjN.title: Dispersive liquid-liquid microextraction method coupled with gas chromatography for determination of dimethylcydosiloxane in water samples
tkq59vjN.abstract: A novel method for the determination of three dimethylcydosiloxanes in water samples was developed by using dispersive liquid-liquid microextraction(DLLME) coupled with gas chromatography-flame ionization detection(GC-FID).The factors relevant to the microextraction efficiency,such as type and volume of extraction solvents and dispersion agent,the extraction time and salt effect were investigated and optimized.Under the optimized extraction conditions,a good linear relationship was obtained in the range of 5～100 μg /L of the analytes with the correlation coefficients greater than 0.99,the detection limits were 2～4 μg/L,the enrichment factors ranged from 165 to 170 and the relative standard deviations(RSD) were in the range of 4.7%～8.0%,respectively.The developed method was applied to the determination of three dimethylcydosiloxanes in tap water and lake water samples,the average recoveries were 108.1%～112.8% with RSD ranged from 4.9% to 8.2%.

ZjR4pwcY.title: The construction, characterization, Hg(II)-sensing and removal behavior of magnetic core-shell nanospheres loaded with fluorescence "Off-On" probe.
ZjR4pwcY.abstract: The present paper constructed and discussed core-shell structured nanospheres grafted with rhodamine based probe for Hg(II) sensing and removal. Electron microscopy images, XRD curves, thermogravimetric analysis and N2 adsorption/desorption isotherms were used to identify the core-shell structure. The inner core consisted of superparamagnetic Fe3O4 nanoparticles, which made the nanocomposite magnetically removable. The outer shell was constructed with silica molecular sieve which provided large surface area and ordered tunnels for the sensing probe, accelerating analyte adsorption and transportation. The rhodamine based sensing probe emission increased with the increasing Hg(II) concentration, showing emission "Off-On" effect, which could be explained by the structural transformation from a non-emissive one to a highly emissive one. The influence from various metal ions and pH values was also investigated, which suggested this structural transformation could only be triggered by Hg(II), showing high selectivity and linear response. The Hg(II) sensing nanocomposite could be regenerated after usage. The response time was slightly compromised and could be further improved.

54BV92Vl.title: Synthesis of Borneol from α-Pinene Catalyzed by Titanium Sulfate
54BV92Vl.abstract: The reaction of borneol from α-pinene(1) catalyzed by titanium sulfate[Ti(SO4)2] were investigated.The optimum reaction conditions were as followed: Ti(SO4)2 was calcined at 400 ℃ for 2 h,n(1) ∶ n(oxalic acid) was 1.0 ∶ 0.4,w[Ti(SO4)2] was 10%,the reaction was carried at 65 ℃ for 1 h,at 75 ℃ for 4 h and at 90 ℃ for 1 h in turn.The yield was 53.98% with content of 50.97% under the optimum.

ExKfZVdt.title: Synthesis and characterization of octa (chloromethyl) silsesquioxane
ExKfZVdt.abstract: Octa(chloromethyl)silsesquioxane(CM-POSS)was prepared by the hydrolysis condensation reaction of chloromethyl trichlorosilane catalyzed by the concentrated hydrochloric acid and anhydrous ferric chloride in the mixed solvent of methanol,chloroform and petroleum ether.The product was characterized by FT-IR,GPC,1H-NMR,29Si-NMR and XRD,the results showed that the product structure was octa(chloromethyl)silsesquioxane,and the product behaved good thermal stability by TGA.

HqTsyNsn.title: Properties of Epoxy Resin Modified by Aniline Methyl Polyhedral Oligomeric Silsesquioxane
HqTsyNsn.abstract: The curing reaction and thermal properties of aniline methyl silsesquioxane(PAM-POSS) /E-44 /MeTHPA / TEA were studied systematically,and the mechanical properties of hybrid resin were also researched.The results indicated that the impact strength and bending strength of the hybrid resin showed a downward trend after the first increase with the PAMPOSS content increased.When PAM-POSS content was 10 %,the impact strength and bending strength reached the maximum.

PSEqfiz4.title: Study on the Synthesis Technology of the Hydroxyl-terminated Polyether Triethoxysilane Coupling Agent
PSEqfiz4.abstract: The hydroxyl-terminated polyether triethoxysilane was synthesized with triethoxysilane and allyl polyether through hydrosilylation with H2PtCl6 as catalyst.The effect of reactant ratio,the amount of catalyst,the molecular weight of allyl polyether and reaction temperature on the reaction system's conversion rate was discussed.When the molecular weight of APEG was 600,the n(APEG)/n(TES) was 1.1,the amount of catalyst was 15mg/L and the reaction temperature was 70℃,the reaction system's conversion rate could reach the max value 100%.At last,the target product of HPTES was characterized by FT-IR.

9xTSlSNi.title: Study on synthesis technology of vinyl tri(β-methoxyethoxy)-silicane
9xTSlSNi.abstract: Vinyl tri(2-methoxyethoxy)silicane was synthesized with vinyl trichlorosilane,methanol and ethylene glycol monomethyl ether through alcoholysis and transesterification reaction.The results showed that the optimal alcoholysis reaction conditions were found as follow:n(vinyl trichlorosilane):n(methanol) = 1:3.6,the reaction temperature was 80℃,the yield of vinyltrimethoxysilane can reach 85%.When n(ViSi(OMe)_3):n (ethylene glycol monomethyl ether) = 1:3.6,reaction temperature was 100℃and reaction time can be identified as 1.5～2.0h,the single-pass yield of transesterification can reach 92%at the optimal condition.At last,the target product was characterized by GC-MS.

Vb9ABq03.title: Optimization of Crosslinking Starch Used in the Synthesis of Insoluble Starch Xanthate
Vb9ABq03.abstract: Using corn starch as raw material,the synthesis of crosslinking starch and its applications in the final product-insoluble starch xanthate is researched.The dosage of crosslinking agent which is epichlorohydrin(ECH),the amount of potassium hydroxide,reaction time and temperature for the crosslinking reaction are discussed.The optimum synthesis conditions in the crosslink reaction obtained by the orthogonal experiments are: potassium hydroxide(25wt%) 8mL,ECH 1.5mL,reaction time 14h.Under the conditions,the removal rate of copper of ISX is 99.94%.

d3KP1ZIX.title: Study on synthesis of amphiphilic triblock copolymers consisting of polysiloxane and poly(ethylene oxide)
d3KP1ZIX.abstract: The PEO-b-PDMS-b-PEO copolymer was synthesized via hydrosilylation reaction between the Si-H double terminated polysiloxane and allyl terminated polyether in a condition of solvent-free.The effects of the type and dosage of amine doping in H2PtCl6,reaction time and reaction temperature on Si-H's conversion rate of reaction system were discussed separately.Experimental results showed that the system's conversion rate had a max value which was 82.9% when the H2PtCl6 was doped with Bu3N according to n(N)/n(Pt)=1,the reaction temperature was 90℃ and the reaction time was 6.5h.At last the production's structure and self-assembly micelle morphology were characterized by FT-IR,DLS and TEM.

Ht9avmRp.title: Process on preparation techology and application of methylphenyldichlorosilane
Ht9avmRp.abstract: Methylphenyldichlorosilane was an important functional organicsilicon monomer,and it had broad application prospects in the synthesis and modification of special silicone synthetic polymer materials.The technical routes and features of preparing methylphenyldichlorosilane were summarized and analyzed,such as condensation method,Grignard method,disproportion method and cleavage method.How to prepare methylphenyldichlorosilane by high-boiling disilanes was a sustainable development technical process to the organic silicone industry.At last,the application of the functional organicsilicon monomer in the synthesis of organicsilicon polymer materials was discussed,such as methylphenyl silicone resin,silicone rubber,silicone fluid and new type of photoelectric materials.

Z2F1IVw1.title: Study on the Preparation of Insoluble Starch Xanthate
Z2F1IVw1.abstract: The preparation of insoluble starch xanthate(ISX) was synthesized using corn starch as raw material.The effects of the content of sodium hydroxide dosage(NaOH),the amount of carbon disulfide(CS2) and the cross-linking degree of starch on the ability removing heavy metal ions of ISX has been studied.The optimum conditions for the preparation of ISX are: 10g of settlement 32 mL cross-linked starch,carbon disulfide 30 % of cross-linked starch,NaOH 15 %(25 wt %) of cross-linked starch,reaction time being 2 hours,reaction temperature 32 ℃.Under this condition,the removal rate of copper in the simulated wastewater(including Cu2+ 30 mg / L) is 99.58 %.

dZz0HSDE.title: Study on the Preparation of Low Molecular Weight Hydroxyl-silicone Oil Catalyzed by Solid Super Acid Catalyst
dZz0HSDE.abstract: A low molecular weight hydroxyl-silicone oil was prepared using hexamethylcyclotrisiloxane(D3) as raw material through ring opening,condensation polymerization and hydrolysis reaction in the present of a catalyst.The effects of the kind of catalyst,the dosage of catalyst,the reaction temperature,the temperature of removal of low molecular and the resusability of catalyst on the yield and quality of product were discussed.Experimental results showed that the S2O2-8/ZrO2-NiO had better catalyst performance than other pattern catalysts.The optimal technology was that the mass amount of S2O2-8/ZrO2-NiO was 2%,the reaction temperature was 40℃,and the temperature of removal of low molecular was 115℃.The yield of low molecular hydroxyl-silicone could reach to 87.2% and its hydroxyl value was 9.13% under the optimal technology condition.When S2O2-8/ZrO2-NiO was used for three times and regenerated,it also could have good catalytic activity again.

M1aM4dAt.title: Effect of Selenium-rich Organo-mineral Fertilizers on Yield and Quality of Tobacco Leaves
M1aM4dAt.abstract: We conducted field experiments in an attempt to access various impacts of using Selenium-rich Organo-Mineral Fertilizers on the roots of tobacco,especially the production quantity of tobacco,,internal quality and selenium concentrations of tobacco.The results indicated that Selenium-rich Organo-mineral Fertilizers did not have negative effects on tobacco growth.On the contrary,they increased the output,improved the appearance and internal qualities of tobacco,and increased the concentration of selenium in tobacco.We did two plot experiments from 2009 to 2010,and one field experiment in 2010.The plot experiment in 2009 showed that the concentration of selenium in tobacco increased by 35.3% in treatment 3,as well as by 37.3% in treatment 4 compared to CK.Also,the selenium concentration increased by 45.8% in field experiment in 2010.The appropriate amount of selenium-rich Organo-mineral fertilizer was 750 kg/ha.

yE5v5XXU.title: Effects of Soil Physical and Chemical Properties on Tobacco Bacterial Wilt in Enshi
yE5v5XXU.abstract: The relationship between occurrence rate of tobacco bacterial wilt at various severities and soil physical and chemical properties was analyzed to investigate the possible cause of the disease occurrence.The results showed that there were close relationship between soil physical and chemical properties and bacterial wilt.The incidence index increased with increasing soil temperature,humidity and compaction,but decreased with increasing soil available potassium,pH,bicarbonate,sulfate and CEC.

1GTXYYx1.title: Effect of Different Burying Amount of Vicia Villosa on Yield and Quality of Flue-cured Tobacco
1GTXYYx1.abstract: Field experiment was carried out to study the effect of different burying amount of Vicia Villosa on growth,yield,quality and chemical composition of flue-cured tobacco when applying 70% chemical fertilizer.The result showed that burying green manure could promote tobacco plant growth,especially leaf development,increase leaf SPAD value,improve dry matter accumulation and leaf yield,and improve tobacco chemical quality.When burying green manure at rate of 22 500 kg/ha,the leaf yield,economic value and ratios of first-class leaf were the highest,and compared with the control,which were respectively increased by14.9%,12.5% and 25.0%.K content of middle leaf and low leaf,and nicotine of top leaf and middle leaf obviously increased.The harmony of chemical composition equaled the control.It suggested that burying green manure at this rate was advisable when applying 70% chemical fertilizer.

npixLQRe.title: Breeding and Characteristics of a New Burley Variety Hefeng Big V
npixLQRe.abstract: "Hefeng Big V" was developed from Burley 37 by using system selection,with stable genetic traits and unanimously tidy group,and released by the Hubei Board for Tobacco Variety Examination and Review in August,2010.Its major economic characters were better than the control variety Eyan 1.The cured leaves are mainly reddish brown,with moderate to strong luster,loose structure,harmonious chemical components;the type of aroma belongs to full burley delicacy with pure after taste,good aroma,aroma is still adequate to more adequate levels thick,finish is still clean,remaining sense of shengjin,mixed gas to a slight,moderate irritation to the smaller,combustion is better,ash gray.Overall quality of the medium to better meet requirement of the tobacco industry.Hefeng Big V has good resistance to TMV,black shank,bacterial wilt,climate of scab and brown spot,and good drought-tolerant ability.

kV8eiL9D.title: Analysis on Microorganisms and Enzymes Activity in Soil of Tobacco Field
kV8eiL9D.abstract: Bacteria,actinomycetes,ammonifying bacteria,nitrifying bacteria and fungi were isolated from soil samples collected from tobacco(Nicotiana tabacum L.) field of Xianfeng county and Enshi city,Hubei Province by dilution spread plate method.Activitiy of sucrase,urease,phosphatase,and catalase were determined using spectrophotometry method.The results showed that quantity of ammonifying bacteria was the most while of actinomycetes and fungi were the least.Quantity of different microorganism fluctuated during tobacco growth period and changed in different trend.Generally,the microorganism increased during tobacco growth period.Quantity of microorganisms was the most at vigorous growing stage of tobacco.Urease activity was high at early period of tobacco growth;while phosphatase activity was high at early and metaphase.During the later period of tobacco growth,sucrase activity increased obviously.Activity of catalase was stable during the whole growth period.

rtxXd4ee.title: Effects of Transplanting Time on Yield and Quality of Flue-cured Tobacco in Enshi
rtxXd4ee.abstract: To study the effects of transplanting time on yield and quality of flue-cured tobacco,we designed transplanting test in Xuanen,Lichuan and Badong.The results showed that: in Xuanen,Shifting the transplanting date to earlier date properly could improve the yield and quality,e,g.in the end of April or beginning of May;in Lichuan there was significant difference among the chemical components of the four treatments.The treatment three and four were better than the other treatments,transplanted tobacco in middle to late May was appropriate;In Badong,the chemical components of tobacco which transplanted on May 9th were more harmonious than on earlier or later dates.Therefore,we suggest the best transplanting date should be on early or middle May.

hItjGEHh.title: Research on Control Efficiency of Protein Pesticide against Tobacco Virus
hItjGEHh.abstract: The results of preventive and treating tobacco virus by protein pesticide showed that,control effects of the two chosen protein pesticides were better than that of CK.The inhibiting effects of fungal protein pesticide,3% high-sensitivity protein pesticide,20% moroxydine hydrochloride-cupric acetate WP were 59.27%,43.73%,44.93%,respectively.The analysis of varance was made,and it had been verified that the variance of control effects among the two selected protein pesticides and water were highly significant.

XehbJS9D.title: Heating Effect of Tobacco Seedling in Enshi
XehbJS9D.abstract: Different electric heating wires at bottom of seedling pool were applied to increase its temperature during tobacco seedling stage and search for method of decreasing seeding time and promote the growth of tobacco seedlings by improving the nutrient solution and the surface temperature.The results of the experiment showed that electric heating could increase the seedling pool water temperature,thus improving the growth and quality of tobacco seedlings,resulting in the time reduction of tobacco seedling.Therefore,with regard to geographical characteristics in Enshi,we suggest that electric heating wires at bottom of the seedling pool with 10 W/m2,20 W/m2 and 40 W/m2 should be applied to seedling pools in low mountain,subalpine and alpine,respectively,so that seedlings can be transplanted timely.

Ni246Ojx.title: Development of Characteristic Tobacco Under Low-carbon Economy
Ni246Ojx.abstract: In the background of global warming,large energy consumption,serious environmental pollution and objectives of "cigarette on the level",this paper described the necessity of developing features tobacco and the damage of tobacco production to the environment,proposed the main measures of developing features tobacco under low-carbon economy.

C1XrriBS.title: Analysis of soil nutrient input and output in Hubei Enshi's tobacco growing field
C1XrriBS.abstract: Analysis of nutrient balance of tobacco field in Enshi was carried out. Result showed that: nitrogen was basically in equilibrium, while phosphorus and potassium were more than needed. Fertilization of Enshi tobacco-growing field should follow a principle of increasing nitrogenous fertilizer, stabilizing phosphate and potash fertilizer. Increasing topdressing ratio and the times, and cropping economic plants was suggested to improve nutrient utilization and reduce residue. Reducing chemical fertilizer input moderately can prevent soil acidification. Increasing organic fertilizer, especially manure, and applying tobacco straw bioorganic manure and green manures were proposed to realize tobacco-ecological nutrient circulation.

SU7WvTCY.title: Occurrence and Control Technique of Tobacco Diseases and Insects Pests in Tobacco-growing Areas around Qingjing River
SU7WvTCY.abstract: Categories of tobacco diseases and insects pests were investigated,and the application values of botanical pesticide and integrated control techniques were analyzed in tobacco-growing areas around Qingjing river.The results indicated that:(1) There were 20 species of infectious disease,more than 90 species within 25 families,8 orders in 2 classes of insects pests,more than 80 species within 7 orders in 2 classes of their natural enemies.(2) After using matrine,the chemical compositions of middle and lower leaves were more harmonious.The composite score of smoking quality of middle leaves was higher than CK.Matrine had better efficiency for Helicoverpa assulta and Myzus persicae.(3) By using integrated control techniques,the occurrence of tobacco diseases and insects pests and the cost for control decreased largely,and the outputs and quality of tobacco leaves increased.

b09L8ZIy.title: The Occurring Characteristics of Underground Insect and Pests in Tobacco Fields of Hubei Province
b09L8ZIy.abstract: Underground insect and pests are the main tobacco pests during tobacco seedling stage.Because of the diverse tobacco species and planting environments in tobacco-planting areas of Hubei province,a systematic investigation on the tobacco underground insect and pests was carried out during April and August,2011 for detecting the dominant species and their occurring pattern in Xianfeng,Wufeng,Baokang and Yunxi county of Hubei province.The results indicated that the population structure of underground pests in four tobacco areas of Hubei province was significantly different.In Enshi,wireworms were the dominant species and then grubs and mole crickets sub-dominated;In Xiangyang,cutworms,grubs and wireworms were often observed;In Yichang,cutworms and grubs predominated;In Shiyan,wireworms and cutworms occurred frequently.The damage caused by underground pests was more serious in Flue-cured tobacco,Maryland tobacco and Oriental tobacco than that in Burley tobacco and Sun-cured tobacco.The pest population during the tobacco seedling stage was also distinct from that at tobacco harvest time,when the density of grubs and wireworms increased greatly.The severity caused by underground pests was correlated with the altitude of tobacco field,and the underground insect pest had higher population density at 1200 m altitude tobacco fields.

efSvQo4Z.title: Diagnosis and surgical management of Hangman's fracture combined with intervertebral disc injury]
efSvQo4Z.abstract: To study the pathology characteristics and management of Hangman's fracture combined with intervertebral disc injury.Twenty-one patients suffered from this special injury were converged in this study. All patients underwent anterior C(2 - 3) discectomy and fusion, 18 cases were fixed by anterior cervical plate. The type of fractures, radiology characteristics, and clinical outcomes were investigated.No graft displacement or absorption, infection and neurologic deterioration occurred. All fresh dislocation of axis and C(2 - 3) angulation were corrected. Fusion of C(2 - 3) intervertebral space and pedicle fracture were acquired in all of the patients. After a mean follow-up of 31 months, ranging from 8 to 48 months, nearly all of the complains disappeared after operation.Hangman's fracture is not restricted at pedicle of the axis. Fracture combined with intervertebral disc injury is a special type of Hangman's fracture. Anterior discectomy and fusion of C(2 - 3) intervertebral disc is an effective operation method in accord with the pathophysiology of this special injury.

PcoDGGjV.title: Mechanism and countermeasures of pulmonary damage after "super" crush injury in rabbit lower extremities
PcoDGGjV.abstract: (Abstract]Objective To establish an animal model of "super" crush injury caused by natural hazard,to study the mechanism of lung damage after the injury,and to explore the effect of endothelin(ET) for the treatments of the super crush injury.Methods Overweight and ultra-long time oppression was applied on the lower extremities of rabbits to model a super crush injury.Mortality of the rabbits was recorded after crush release.Lung compliance,airway resistance and ET-1 in plasma and bronchoalveolar lavage fluid(BALF) were detected.ET-1 antagonist(Bosentan) and 0.9%sodium chloride solution were injected into the models of the treating group and the control group,respectively.The mortality,ET-1 concentration in plasma and BALF and lung ventilation function were compared between different groups.Results The rabbits were crushed under a 35 kg object for 7 d.The death rate was 2/12 in one hour after pressure release.No arterial embolism happened in the lung main arteries. Pulmonary hemorrhage and edema were found.There were significant differences in terms of lung compliance and airway resistance between control group and normal group before pressure release(P<0.01).Lung compliance and airway resistance within one hour and at one hour after crush release were not significantly different from that before crush release in the control group(P>0.05) or in the treatment group(P>0.05).Plasma ET-1 concentrations 5 min before release and in BALF in 1 h after crush release were significantly different from those in normal group(P<0.01).ET-1 concentrations 5 min and 1 h after crush release were not significantly different from that 5 min before crush release(P>0.05).ET-1 concentrations and BALF in the control group were not significantly different from those in the treatment group(P>0.05).Conclusion There may be a correlation between lung airway resistance and serum ET-1.But the release from crush injury can not significantly impact lung airway resistance,lung compliance,and the ET-1 concentrations in the plasma and BALF.Bosentan (Ro24720203),a ET-1 antagonist,can not improve lung function in a short period of time and reduce mortality in rabbit.

rVm3Pqgb.title: Effect of zoledronic acid on bone destruction in rabbit' s osteomyelitis
rVm3Pqgb.abstract: [Objective]To study the effect of zoledronic acid(ZA) on bone destruction in the New Zealand white rabbit tibial osteomyelitis model.[Methods]Thirty-five New Zealand white rabbits were divided into three groups:the blank group with 5 rabbits,the model group with 15 rabbits infected by staphylococcus aureus,the zoledronic acid group with 15 rabbits which the zoledronic acid was used on the basis of the model proup.The X-ray film,WBC,CRP,osteocalcin(BGP) and tartrate resistant acid phosphatase(TRACP-5b) were detected at the 2nd,4th and 6th week.[Results]There was a statistically significant difference between the ZA group and model group on X-Norden osteomyelitis scores(P<0.05).WBC,CRP significantly increased at the 2nd week,and gradually decreased from the 4th week.There was not significant difference between the two groups.CRP of the two groups were always higher than in the blank group(P<0.01).The serum BGP of the ZA group was lower than in the model group at the 2nd and 4th week(P<0.05).The serum TRACP-5b of the ZA group was significantly lower than in the model group(P<0.01),and compared with the blank group,there was significant difference from the 4th week(P<0.01).[Conclusion]Zoledronic acid can inhibit the osteoclast activity during the osteomyelitis formation process in the rabbit model.It can slow the bone destruction and delay the development of osteomyelitis.

OG8PabEM.title: The study on the reform of evaluation system in standardized resident training
OG8PabEM.abstract: Objective: During the implementing course of new standardized resident training policy,Shanghai East Hospital has taken some reform measures on the old resident evaluation system,which aims to find a more reasonable and effective evaluation process in standardized resident training.Methods: The reform of evaluation system for the resident doctor included purpose,contents,process,and association with performance.Results: The enthusiasm of the residents has been fully motivated as the result of new evaluation system,and the management efficiency has been promoted as well.Conclusion: To establish a more suitable evaluation system for standardized residency training could improve the quality of standardized resident training effectively.

UVoPHkVL.title: Simple artery anastomosis of finger distal segment replantation
UVoPHkVL.abstract: Objective To discuss the method and results of the simple artery anastomosis of finger distal segment replantation.Methods The artery anastomosis of the finger distal segment replantation of 25 fingers in 23 cases was retrospectively analyzed.The line digital artery anastomosis was performed in accordance with conventional method.In case there was a severe defect of artery,the anastomosis was performed after the transplantation with the contralateral artery;and the superior side artery was preferred whenever possible.Meanwhile,bloodletting of nail bed was carried out for 2-4 days with a No.7 infusion needle(bloodletting puncture) according to the tissue tension,and effective blood circulation can be established 2-5 days after nail-bed bloodletting.Results Twenty-three fingers survived,2 failed,the survival rate being 92%.The growth and appearance of the nails were satisfactory.Being plumpness,replanted fingers were of healthy color,normal temperature and good function,with 2-PD of 3-6 mm.Conclusion Simple artery anastomosis of finger distal segment replantation shortens the operation time and raises survival rate,resulting in satisfactory temperature and function of the replanted fingers.Of the multiple factors for successful surgeries,the post-operational bloodletting by puncture at the nail bed is the key point.

hyCLhYyP.title: Research Progress of Modic Changes of Lumbar Spine
hyCLhYyP.abstract: Modic changes are the signal changes of lumbar vertebral end-plate and subchondral bone marrow on MRI which have a close relation with lumbar disc degeneration.The incidence of Modic changes with disc degenerative disease is significantly higher than normal,which increases with age.Different types of Modic change are the same pathological changes in different periods,whereas the mixed type is thought to be a transitional stage.Whether ModicⅡchange is a stable stage is still controversial.The quantitative research of Modic change is still insufficient,and the exact pathological mechanism is still not clear,which is thought to be the results of the combination of biochemical,biomechanical and genetic factors.

O3eG0aCr.title: Retrospective study of acute spinal cord injury between 2005 and 2007 in Pudong New Area,Shanghai
O3eG0aCr.abstract: Objective To understand the incidence,medical process and specialized management of acute spinal cord injury(ASCI) in Pudong New Area,Shanghai.Methods All the medical records of ASCI between 2005 and 2007 in the first-class and second-class hospitals in Pudong New Area were retrospectively studied.Results A total of 200 cases were included in the study.The annual incidence of ASCI in Pudong New Area was 25 per million;and the majority of patients were middle-aged construction workers,hence it affected the labor force.The highest hospital expense was 300 thousand RMB,and the total expense added up to 9.67 million RMB.The average daily cost was 2,026 RMB,and the per capita cost was 48,300 RMB.Among the 117 cases who reached hospitals in 8 hours after ASCI occurred,only 32 of them were treated with Methylprednisolone at once.Totally,114 cases underwent surgeries,in which the mean operation time was 3.2 hours,the intraoperative blood loss averaged 538 ml(200~3 000 ml) and the mean blood transfusion was 731 ml(100~2 600 ml).However,the assessment of efficacy in the original medical records was not clear.Conclusion The incidence of ASCI has a tendency to increase,and it is of great importance for the treatment of ASCI patients to enhance the correct pre-hospital care at the medical emergency centers and to improve the management process of hospital emergency staff.In addition,the diagnosis,assessment and information recording of ASCI patients remain to be further upgraded.

Drlu8Rhx.title: Determining a Safe Lateral Ach Screw Trajectory of Vertebra Dentata by Employing Unigraphics Software to Simulate three Dimensional Body
Drlu8Rhx.abstract: Objective:To search for a safe lateral screw trajectory on the reconstructed 3D computer imaginary body based on thin-slice CT scanning of vertebra dentata.Methods:Four isolated dry dentata and eight fresh specimens were enrolled in this experiment.Consecutive CT images of each sample were scanned with 0.6 mm in thickness and interval distance.With help of UG software(NX edition),3D reconstruction body of vertebra dentata axis was built up.The screws in various diameters and shapes meeting special demands were simulated,then positioned according to imaginary trajectory and readjusted until satisfactory entrance point and inclination of needling.Results:CT images showed that the lateral cortex at transverse foramen region(anterior region of lateral arch) was obvious thinner.Some specimen possessed a hole for nutrient artery,which induced congenital deficient in the lateral cortex of vertebral arch.Distinguished by transverse process,the route orientation of lateral vertebral arch in anterior region did not parallel to that in posterior region;and the orientation in upper part of cervical foramen region was different from that in median and lower parts.By simulating different entrance point and end point in imaginary axis with computer,a satisfactory screw trajectory can finally be obtained,which parallel neither to the orientation of upper part of anterior portion nor to that of posterior portion,but was largely restricted by the orientation of median and lower part of anterior portion of lateral arch.Conclusions:Existence of nourishing vessel hole at the lateral cortex of anterior region of lateral arch of axis makes the cortex of lateral arch congenital deficient.The conventional methods to judge the screw safe trajectory is questionable.A safe screw trajectory of lateral arch of axis can be got by UG-software simulating methods,and appropriate length and diameter of screw could be determined preoperatively.

fjGhDfrs.title: Pedicle screw fixation or combined with lateral mass screw fixation in treatment of Hangman's fracture
fjGhDfrs.abstract: Objective:To define the indications of C2 pediele lag-screw or C2 pedicle screw combined with C3 lateral mass screw to treat Hangman's fracture and evaluate the result of the technique.Method:44 pa- tients with Hangman's fracture were converged from March 2001 to August 2005.12,15,11 and 6 patients were classified as typeⅠ,Ⅱ,Ⅱa andⅢinjuries respectively according to Levine-Edwards classification,and the grade was made as C spinal injury in 4 cases,D in 16 cases and E in 24 cases according to Frankel scale.TypeⅠHangman's fracture fixed by C2 pedicle lag-screw.TypeⅡ,Ⅱa andⅢHangman's fracture fixed by C2 pedicle screw combined with C3 lateral mass screw.Result:There were no vertebra artery injury or other complications during the operation.According to Frankel classification,in 4 cases of Grade C,2 cases of them recovered up to Grade E,the others recovered up to Grade D.In 16 cases of Grade D,14 cases of them recovered up to Grade E,the others no neurologic deterioration at 3～6 months of follow-up,X-ray showed all cases gained bony union.Conclusion:C2 pedicle lag-aerew or C2 pedicle screw comhined with C3 lateral mass screw to treat Hangman's fracture is an effective method,which can get superordinary therapeutic effect.

xRxD8KsP.title: Percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combined with mini-open anterior bone grafting for the treatment of thoracolumbar fracture
xRxD8KsP.abstract: Background:In the treatment of unstable thoracolumbar fractures,the major problem after posterior correction and instrumentation is failure to support the anterior spinal column,leading to the loss of correction of kyphosis and instrumentation breakage. Objective:The purpose of the present study is to investigate the efficacy of percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combined with mini- open anterior bone grafting for the treatment of thoracolumbar fracture. Methods:A total of 14 patients with type A thoracolumbar fractures without neurological deficit were treated by percutaneous pedicle screw fixation(Viper system)combined with mini-open anterior bone grafting.Radiographic and clinical outcomes were retrospectively studied. Results:All the patients were followed up with an average duration of 14 months.The evaluation fo clinical outcomes were excellent and good.Radiograph indicated fracture healing in all cases and there were no instrumentation failure.The anterior height percentage of compressed vertebral body and kyphosis angle were 71.7%±7.5%and 19.6°±3.4°preoperatively,94.7% ±3.5%and 5.0°±2.7°postoperatively,88.7%±4.2%and 9.9±2.6°at the final follow-up,retrospectively. Conclusions:Percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combined with mini-open anterior bone grafting is an effective minimally invasive technique for thoracolumbar fracture.

SHVoa1ea.title: Research progress of iatrogenic vertebral artery injury
SHVoa1ea.abstract: Iatrogenic vertebral artery injury is a rare complication in cervical spine surgeries,the consequences of which may be catastrophic.With the extensive development of cervical spine surgeries and application of diverse new internal fixations of cervical spine,there is a potential increase of risk of iatrogenic vertebral artery injury,which should be paid attention to.This article reviews the rate,cause and management etc.of iarogenic vertebral artery injury.

e6o06fBX.title: Fusion techniques for adult isthmic spondylolisthesis: a systematic review.
e6o06fBX.abstract: Various fusion techniques have been used to treat lumbar spine isthmic spondylolisthesis (IS) in adults, including anterior lumbar interbody fusion (ALIF), posterior lumbar interbody fusion (PLIF), transforaminal lumbar interbody fusion (TLIF), posterolateral fusion (PLF), and circumferential fusion. The objective of this study was to evaluate which fusion technique provides the best clinical and radiological outcome for adult lumbar IS.A systematic review was performed. MEDLINE databases and reference lists of selected articles were searched. Inclusion criteria stated that the studies had to be controlled and that they compared clinical and radiological outcomes of various fusion techniques for treating adult IS. Exclusion criteria were use of only one treatment and non-English language articles. Two reviewers independently extracted relevant data from each included study. Statistical comparisons were made when appropriate.Nine studies that compared two surgical approaches to IS were included in this systematic review. Three were prospective studies, and six were retrospective studies. Two studies compared ALIF with instrumented PLF and ALIF with percutaneous pedicle screw fixation, two studies compared ALIF and TLIF, and five studies compared PLIF and PLF. ALIF was superior to other techniques regarding restoration of disc height, segmental lordosis, and whole lumbar lordosis. TLIF had lower complication rates. ALIF combined with PLF showed lower nonfusion rates than other techniques. However, there were no significant differences in clinical outcomes between any two techniques.Compared to other fusion techniques, TLIF shows fewer complications, ALIF shows better sagittal alignment, and circumferential fusion showed better fusion rates. It was difficult to make recommendations about the optimal approach because of the methodological variance in the publications.

3Fs9UnCy.title: Research Progress of Clinical Application of the Artificial Disc
3Fs9UnCy.abstract: Anterior cervical decompression and fusion(ACDF)treatment of cervical disease has some clinical efficacy,but it accelerates the segment disc degeneration.Compared with ACDF treatment,artificial disc prosthesis design is consistent with the anatomical structure of human cervical spine,ensuring that the instantaneous and long-term stability after surgery with good effect achieved.Here is to make a review on the type of artificial disc and the efficacy,indications and contraindications,as well as the postoperative complications.

EKLp16MC.title: A Big Challenge of Surgical Robot——Haptic Feedback
EKLp16MC.abstract: Due to high accuracy and minimal invasive,robotic surgery has been widely accepted by surgeons.However,the lack of intraoperative sense of touch(haptic feedback) can increase uncertainty and bring risks in the surgery,which is regarded as the biggest limitation of the robot surgery and require further development.In this article,haptic feedback system was reviewed from the system composition,key techniques and current research status.Haptic feedback includes force feedback and tactile feedback.The implementation of the system relies on the haptic sense and display.Commonly used haptic sensor,display device,sensory substitution techniques and the analysis on the corresponding advantages and disadvantages were introduced in the review.Research progress of the haptic feedback system in surgical robot was outlined as well.At last,the future research direction was suggested on the basis of the previous studies.

Y4dIDm3d.title: Clinical study of percutaneous locking plate for treatment of distal tibia fractures
Y4dIDm3d.abstract: Objective To study the operative technique and clinical result of treating distal tibia fracture by internal fixation with percutaneous locking plate.Methods Thirty-five cases of distal tibia fractures were treated by internal fixation with percutaneous locking plate from 2004 August to 2006 September.According to AO classification,18 cases were type A fracture,10 cases were type B and 7 cases were type C.Twenty-three cases were complicated with ipsilateral fibular fracture.Six cases were open fractures.Results The average follow-up period was 9.8 months(range 6~21 months).All cases achieved bony healing with the average healing period of 4.2 months(range 3~10 months).According to Johner and Wruhs' standard,there were 21 excellent cases,11 good cases and 3 fair cases.The rate of excellent and good cases was 91.4%.Conclusion Internal fixation with percutaneous locking plate is an effective method to treat distal tibia fracture and can achieve good clinical results if the operation skills could be mastered correctly.

UbpRoQJV.title: Effect of C(1-2) venous sinus upon operative safety of atlantoaxial screw insertion]
UbpRoQJV.abstract: To introduce a new C(1) screw insertion technique to avoid injury to C(1-2) venous sinus in posterior atlantoaxial fixation.48 cases (96 sides of C(1) screws) undergoing posterior atlantoaxial fixation were retrospectively analyzed, including 28 cases of C(1) or C(2) fresh fracture and 20 cases of congenital malformation or old fracture & dislocation, among which 12 cases (24 sides) were operated by Goel lateral mass screws, 14 cases (28 sides) by TAN Mingsheng C(1) transpedicular screws and 44 sides of C(1) screws in 22 cases were inserted via notch on underside of C(1) posterior arch combined with bone wax column protecting C(1-2) venous sinus.Bleeding was encountered in five sides of C(1) screws among 26 cases (52 sides) whose venous sinuses were not protected by bone wax column, involving 3 cases of Goel lateral screw implant fixation. There was statistical difference in the incidence rate of bleeding between Goel technique and ours (P < 0.05) while there was no statistical difference between C(1) transpedicular technique and ours (P > 0.05) or between Goel sides of Goel lateral mass screws (12.5%) and 2 sides of C(1) transpedicular screws (7.1%). It occurred in none of 22 cases (44 sides) with our presented technique. There was a significant difference between Goel lateral screw implant fixation and C(1) transpedicular technique (P > 0.05). All the screws were implanted successfully. All cases were followed up and there was not any sign of implant failure.Our presented C(1) screw insertion technique can provide a better bony landmark and vascular protection, stronger bony holding power and more extensive applicability to reduce injury to C(1-2) venous sinus and increase the surgical safety.

Ozyv1K8I.title: The effect of lithium on the spine cordinjury rats
Ozyv1K8I.abstract: Objective To observe the effect of lithium on spine cord injury(SCI) rats and compare the neuro-protection of different doses of lithium chloride on SCI rats.Methods The models were made by the technique of NYC method.50 rats were randomly divided into 5 groups: none treated group(NO,n=10)、treated with NaCl group(NA,n=10)、treated with 2 mEq/kg LiCl(LI2,n=10)、treated with 4 mEq/kg LiCl(LI4,n=10)、treated with 6mEq/kg LiCl(LI6,n=10).All the rats were injected intraperitoneally with lithium chloride once a day for 28 consecutive days.Evaluate the recovery of hindlimb movements by BBB(Basso,Beattie,Bresna hanLocomotor Rating Scale) scale in every group of rats.Estimate the spinal cord function by latency of motor evoked potential(MEP).At the end of the behavioral assessment,all the injured spine were perfusion-fixed and made into paraffin sections for HE stain to observe the nerves.Results(1)There was no difference between none treated and NA group(P>0.05).All the groups treated with LiCl were better than control groups on the recovery of MEP(P<0.05)but no difference among different LiCl groups.(2)The gray matter of injured spine cord were liquefied and putrefied with cava formation its interface was made up by vein、glia and macrophages after four weeks of operation.The groups treated with LiCl reserved a part of gray and white matter and the number of never cells was decreased.(3)The grade of the group treated with 4mEq/kg was better than other treated groups and the treated groups were better than control groups by BBB scale.(4) The death rate among all the groups had no difference.Conclusion Lithium Chloride can decrease the injury of the spine cord and improve the recovery of hindlimb movements.

jZUC3qXG.title: Comparison of unilateral versus bilateral pedicle screw fixation in degenerative lumbar diseases: a meta-analysis.
jZUC3qXG.abstract: Traditionally, lumbar spinal surgery is performed with bilateral pedicle screw fixation to provide stability as the fusion heals. However, many studies have reported that unilateral pedicle screw fixation is as effective as bilateral constructs. To compare the clinical outcomes, complications, and surgical trauma between the two techniques for treatment of degenerative lumbar diseases, we conducted a meta-analysis.We searched MEDLINE, EMBASE, PubMed, Google Scholar, and Cochrane databases for relevant controlled studies up to August 2013 that compared unilateral with bilateral fixation for the treatment of degenerative lumbar diseases. We independently performed title/abstract screening and full-text screening. A random effects model was used for heterogeneous data; otherwise, a fixed effect model was used, pooling data using mean difference (MD) for continuous outcomes and odds ratio (OR) for dichotomous outcomes.A total of 12 articles (865 participants) were eligible. Overall, there were significant differences between the two groups for blood loss (MD = -171.73, 95 % CI = -281.70 to -61.76; p = 0.002), operation time (MD = -66.02, 95 % CI = -115.52 to -16.51; p = 0.009), and fusion rate (OR = 0.50, 95 % CI = 0.26-0.96; p = 0.004). However, there were no significant differences in hospital stay (MD = -4.44, 95 % CI = -13.37 to 4.50), ODI (MD = -0.09, 95 % CI = -0.59 to 0.42; p = 0.74), JOA (MD = 0.18, 95 % CI = -0.77 to 1.14; p = 0.71), VAS (MD = -0.04, 95 % CI = -0.16 to 0.08; p = 0.49), SF-36 (PF: MD = -1.11, 95 % CI = -4.38 to 2.17, p = 0.51; GH: MD = 1.22, 95 % CI = -2.17 to 4.60, p = 0.48; MH: MD = -0.22, 95 % CI = -3.83 to 3.38, p = 0.90) and complications (OR = 1.15, 95 % CI = 0.72-1.85; p = 0.56).This meta-analysis shows that there was significantly less blood loss in unilateral group and less operating time; however, the fusion rate was significantly higher in the bilateral group. The outcomes of hospital stay, ODI, JOA, VAS, SF-36 score, and complications are similar in the two groups.

gUApxKet.title: Therapeutic value of posterior approach surgical treatment for cervical spondylotic myelopathy
gUApxKet.abstract: Objective To study the therapeutic effects of posterior approach surgical treatment on cervical spondylotic myelopathy.Methods Thirty-five patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy operated by posterior approach surgical treatment from Jan.2005 to Jan.2009 were analyzed retrospectively.There were 20 males and 12 females in this study with an average age of 56.5 years old(ranged from 34 to 72 years).The invasional segments were C_2～1C_7 in 2 cases,C_3～T_1 in 4 cases,C_3～C_7 in 29 cases.All cases had the posterior cervical open-door laminoplasty decompression.All the cases were followed up after operation.Neural function was recorded according to JOA score,improvement rates were calculated respectively.Results After discharge, the scores of JOA increased 2～5 points compared with that before operation.The function of the neural function showed excellent in 9 cases,good in 8,fair in 14 and poor in 4.The good-excellent rate was 48.57%.All cases were regularly followed up.The average duration of follow-up was 13.5 months(ranged from 6 to 24 months).The scores of JOA increased 3-8 points compared with that when discharged.The function of the neural function showed excellent in 11 cases,good in 14,fair in 7 and poor in 3.The good-excellent rate was 71.43%.Conclusion The posterior approach surgical treatment for cervical spondylotic myelopathy is able to raise the clinical improvement rate and to reduce the occurrence of the complications.

61Kfvfjz.title: Direct posterior C1 lateral mass screws compression reduction and osteosynthesis in the treatment of unstable jefferson fractures
61Kfvfjz.abstract: STUDY DESIGN.: Technical case report. OBJECTIVE.: To investigate a new concept and surgical technique in the treatment of unstable Jefferson fractures, which preserves the motion of upper cervical spine, avoiding fusion. SUMMARY OF BACKGROUND DATA.: The management of unstable Jefferson fractures remains controversial. Conservative treatment usually involves a long time of immobilization in halo vest, whereas surgical intervention generally performs fusion, eliminating the range of motion of upper cervical spine. METHODS.: Two patients with unstable Jefferson fractures were surgically treated via direct posterior C1 lateral mass screws compression reduction and osteosynthesis technique, aiming at restoring the C0-C2 height and maintaining the vertical ligamentous tension for C0-C1-C2 complex stability despite the incompetent transverse ligament, achieving physiologic repair instead of traditional fusion. The clinical and radiographic results were documented. RESULTS.: The postoperative CT showed that C1 lateral mass screws were well positioned. At 1-year follow-up, plain radiographs, and CT scan revealed no implant failure, good cervical alignment, and bony healing of the fractures; no C1-C2 instability was observed on the flexion-extension radiographs. The patients were completely pain-free, with full range of motion of the cervical spine. CONCLUSION.: The ideal treatment of unstable Jefferson fractures is expected to preserve the function of C0-C1-C2. Unstable Jefferson fractures involve the concomitant failure of the vertical ligamentous tension because of the loss of C0-C2 height. Reduction of the displaced lateral masses to restore the C0-C2 height and maintain the ligamentous tension is the key to the surgery. Direct posterior C1 lateral mass screws compression reduction and osteosynthesis is a valid technique, avoiding fusion of upper cervical spine. Copyright © 2011 Lippincott Williams & Wilkins.

caZh0YdC.title: Digitalized design of extraforaminal lumbar interbody fusion: a computer-based simulation and cadaveric study.
caZh0YdC.abstract: This study aims to investigate the feasibility of a novel lumbar approach named extraforaminal lumbar interbody fusion (ELIF), a newly emerging minimally invasive technique for treating degenerative lumbar disorders, using a digitalized simulation and a cadaveric study.The ELIF surgical procedure was simulated using the Mimics surgical simulator and included dissection of the superior articular process, dilation of the vertebral foramen, and placement of pedicle screws and a cage. ELIF anatomical measures were documented using a digitalized technique and subsequently validated on fresh cadavers.The use of the Mimics allowed for the vivid simulation of ELIF surgical procedures, while the cadaveric study proved the feasibility of this novel approach. ELIF had a relatively lateral access approach that was located 8-9 cm lateral to the median line with an access depth of approximately 9 cm through the intermuscular space. Dissection of the superior articular processes could fully expose the target intervertebral discs and facilitate a more inclined placement of the pedicle screws and cage with robust enhancement.According to the computer-based simulation and cadaveric study, it is feasible to perform ELIF. Further research including biomechanical study is needed to prove ELIF has a superior ability to preserve the posterior tension bands of the spinal column, with similar effects on spinal decompression, fixation, and fusion, and if it can enhance post-fusion spinal stability and expedites postoperative recovery.

2Jjhz5D6.title: One-stage surgical management and allograft in the treatment of multisegments spinal tuberculosis
2Jjhz5D6.abstract: [Objective]To assess the efficacy of one-stage anterior radical debridement,decompression,and fusion with anterior and/or posterior spinal instrumentation in the treatment of multisegments spinal tuberculosis.[Method]From 2001 and 2005,a total of 15 patients included thoracic,thoracolumbar and lumbar spinal tuberculosis underwent anterior debridement,allograft bone fusion,and stabilization with anterior and posterior instrumentation.The mini-invasive technique including thoracoscope and X-tube were applied in the later 8 cases.[Result]An average of 2.1 years' follow-up was achieved in 16 patients.The overall fusion rate was 100% in the dynamic lateral views.There was no graft problems.The kyphosis angles that were corrected postoperatively averaged 19.9°.All patients' neurological function were improved except that there was no change in 1 patient with Frankel grade B preoperatively.[Conclusion]Reconstructing the stability of spine is very important for the treatment of spinal tuberculosis.The application of internal instrument and allograft,choosing appropriate surgery can greatly improve the clinical results.Mini-invasive technique reduced blood lost and made the operation easier.

GoN4lQ5M.title: Factors Affecting the Non-Linear Force Versus Distraction Height Curves in an In Vitro C5-6 Anterior Cervical Distraction Model.
GoN4lQ5M.abstract: In vitro biomechanical study of cervical intervertebral distraction.To investigate the forces required for distraction to different heights in an in vitro C5-6 anterior cervical distraction model, focusing on the influence of the intervertebral disc, posterior longitudinal ligament (PLL), and ligamentum flavum (LF).No previous studies have reported on the forces required for distraction to various heights or the factors resisting distraction in anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF).Anterior cervical distraction at C5-6 was performed in six cadaveric specimens using a biomechanical testing machine, under four conditions: A, before disc removal; B, after disc removal; C, after disc and PLL removal; and D, after disc and PLL removal and cutting of the LF. Distraction was performed from 0 to 10 mm at a constant velocity (5 mm/min). Force and distraction height were recorded automatically.The force required increased with distraction height under all four conditions. There was a sudden increase in force required at 6-7 mm under Conditions B and C, but not D. Under Condition A, distraction to 5 mm required a force of 268.3±38.87 N. Under Conditions B and C, distraction to 6 mm required <15 N, and further distraction required dramatically increased force, with distraction to 10 mm requiring 115.4±10.67 N and 68.4±9.67 N, respectively. Under Condition D, no marked increase in force was recorded.Distraction of the intervertebral space was much easier after disc removal. An intact LF caused a sudden marked increase in the force required for distraction, possibly indicating the point at which the LF was fully stretched. This increase in resistance may help to determine the optimal distraction height to avoid stress to the endplate spacer.

8NKjQSHw.title: Time-related use of methylprednisolone on acute spinal cord injury in rats
8NKjQSHw.abstract: Objective:To explore the effect of time-related use of methylprednisolone(MP) on acute spinal cord injury(SCI) in rats so as to provide theoretical guide for the proper use of MP for preservation of spinal function.Method:216 adult SD rats(3-month-old),ranging from 190 to 240g in weight,were randomly divided into four groups,sham group(A),spinal injury group(B),MP treating group(C) and MP prophylaxis group(D).SCI model(T8-T9) was done in group B,C and D by modified Allen′s method.MP was administered intravenously in group D(30mg/kg) 0.5h before injury,and group C(30mg/kg) 1h after injury.MP was administered to group C and D at 6,12,18 and 24h after injury respectively(31.05mg/kg each time),and 0.5ml normal saline was administered in group A and B at the same time-point.The spinal cord function was evaluated by the disabled rate of hindlimb locomotor function(n=6) and Rivlin′s rate of slope(n=6) every 24,48 and 72h after injury.At 8,24,48 and 72h after injury,light microscope(n=6) and electronmicroscope(n=6) was used to observe the pathological changes of the injuried spinal segment in each group.Result:There was no significant difference within group A and B at each time-point in the disabled rate of hindlimb locomotor function(P> 0.05),while those in group C and D decreased with time(P<0.05).There was also no significant difference within group A at each time-pointor within group B and D at 48h and 72h after injury with respect to Rivlin′s rate of slope(P>0.05),but the difference within group C at each time-point or within group B or D at the other time spots was significant(P<0.05).Disabled rate of hindlimb locomotor function and Rivlin′s rate of slope in group B,C and D at each time-point were higher than those in group A(P<0.05).There was no significant difference between group C and B 24 or 48h after injury(P>0.05),but the rates in group C 72h after injury and group D at each time-point were lower than those in group B(P<0.05).The difference of Rivlin′s rate of slope between group D 72h after injury and group C was not siginificant(P>0.05),but the disabled rate of hindlimb locomotor function fin group D 72h after injury and both rates 24 or 48h after in-jury were far below those in group C.In group A,the boundary between gray-white matter was clear and neurons were evidenced abundant with clear appearance;in group B,multiple hemorrhage and necrosis was seen in the injured spinal cord;the number of neurons decreased and microstructures inside the residual neurons were confused;the structure of myelin sheath became disorder,gradually aggravated;the lesion in group C was minor than that in group B,and the structures inside the residual neurons were a little bit confused, which graudually relieved 24 hours later;the lesion in group D was the mildest compared with group B and C;few hemorrhage was seen,the organelles in neurons swelled mildly,and the swelling almost disappeared 24 hours later.Conclusion:Methylprednisolone can relieve the degree of secondary injury following acute spinal cord injury in rats and it will be better to use MP half an hour before surgery rather than after surgery.

BmyVdAVf.title: C1 lateral mass screw insertion with protection of C1-C2 venous sinus: technical note and review of the literature.
BmyVdAVf.abstract: This is a technical note and review of the literature.We propose to describe a revised surgical technique of C1 lateral mass screw insertion with protection of C1-C2 venous sinus surrounding the C2 nerve root.During C1 lateral mass screw insertion and in posterior C1-C2 fixation, iatrogenic injury of C1-C2 venous sinus results in bleeding, which is troublesome. Appropriate management of the venous sinus in this region is critical to successful surgery in this complex anatomic region.We reviewed 48 patients who underwent posterior C1-C2 fixation at our institution between September 2001 and October 2008. Twenty-four atlas screws were inserted by the originally described C1 lateral mass screw technique (group A), and 28 through a revised posterior arch and lateral mass screw technique (C1 transpedicular screw) (group B). The final group of 44 atlas screws was placed with our newly revised technique (group C).Bleeding of venous sinus was encountered in 3 group A, 2 group B, and 1 group C atlas screw insertions. The incidence rate was 12.50% (A), 7.14% (B), and 2.27% (C). Statistical comparison showed no significant difference between the groups. All the cases were followed for a mean period of 28.1 month. Four patients in group A complained of postoperative numbness in occipitocervical region. No patients in group B or group C voiced this complaint. A high fusion rate was found in all 3 groups with no signs of implant failure.Bleeding of C1-C2 venous sinus is vigorous and frustrating. The revised technique we describe provides theoretical and practical protection of venous sinus. In addition, the firm bony purchase of screws afforded by this technique contributes to achieving stabilization of the upper cervical spine and a high fusion rate.

qm8p6sbW.title: Efficacy and Safety of Loxonin in Orthopaedic Disease Patients:Results from a Prospective,Multi-Center Registry Study of 1505 Patients
qm8p6sbW.abstract: Objective:Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs(NSAIDs) are widely used to treat the pain in orthopaedic patients despite concerns about toxic effects.Cyclo-oxygenase(COX)-2-selective NSAIDs reduced the risk of gastrointestinal events.But concerns about cardiovascular disease associated with COX-2-selective NSAIDs increased.Non-selective NSAIDs were re-evaluated.Methods: We undertook a prospective,multicenter,registy study in hospitalized patients with pain in orthopaedic department from 2009.6 to 2010.4.A total of 1 505 cases were included and received Loxonin.Effects of pain relieving and side-effect were recorded.Results: A total of 1112 cases(74.35%)received Loxonin 60mg as the initial-dose and 382 cases(25.38%)received 120mg.Pain relieved from 15 min to 30 min in 835 cases(55.48%).The average time to halve the visual analogue scale(VAS) score was 28.19±0.78 min.Conclusions: Loxonin is a safe,effective and cheap treatment to patients with mild to moderate pain.

h40sHlWK.title: Is anterior cervical discectomy and fusion superior to corpectomy and fusion for treatment of multilevel cervical spondylotic myelopathy? A systemic review and meta-analysis.
h40sHlWK.abstract: Both anterior cervical discectomy with fusion (ACDF) and anterior cervical corpectomy with fusion (ACCF) are used to treat cervical spondylotic myelopathy (CSM), however, there is considerable controversy as to whether ACDF or ACCF is the optimal treatment for this condition. To compare the clinical outcomes, complications, and surgical trauma between ACDF and ACCF for the treatment of CSM, we conducted a meta-analysis.We conducted a comprehensive search in MEDLINE, EMBASE, PubMed, Google Scholar and Cochrane databases, searching for relevant controlled trials up to July 2013 that compared ACDF and ACCF for the treatment of CSM. We performed title and abstract screening and full-text screening independently and in duplicate. A random effects model was used for heterogeneous data; otherwise, a fixed effect model was used to pool data, using mean difference (MD) for continuous outcomes and odds ratio (OR) for dichotomous outcomes.Of 2157 citations examined, 15 articles representing 1372 participants were eligible. Overall, there were significant differences between the two treatment groups for hospital stay (M = -5.60, 95% CI = -7.09 to -4.11), blood loss (MD = -151.35, 95% CI = -253.22 to -49.48), complications (OR = 0.50, 95% CI = 0.35 to 0.73) and increased lordosis of C2-C7 (MD = 3.70, 95% CI = 0.96 to 6.45) and fusion segments angles (MD = 3.38, 95% CI = 2.54 to 4.22). However, there were no significant differences in the operation time (MD = -9.34, 95% CI = -42.99 to 24.31), JOA (MD = 0.24, 95% CI = -0.10 to 0.57), VAS (MD = -0.06, 95% CI = -0.81 to 0.70), NDI (MD = -1.37, 95% CI  = -3.17 to 0.43), Odom criteria (OR = 0.88, 95% CI = 0.60 to 1.30) or fusion rate (OR = 1.17, 95% CI = 0.34 to 4.11).Based on this meta-analysis, although complications and increased lordosis are significantly better in the ACDF group, there is no strong evidence to support the routine use of ACDF over ACCF in CSM.

nCAxwolK.title: Percutaneous Pedicle screw Fixation Combine with Contralateral MIS -TLIF Under C -arm Navigation in the Treatment of Lumbar Stenosis
nCAxwolK.abstract: Objective To investigate the outcome of percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combine with contralateral MissTLIF under c-arm navigation in the treatment of lumbar stenosis.Methods From June 2010 to June 2012,47 patients with lumbar stenosis underwent the operation of percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combine with contralateral Miss-TLIF under c-arm navigation.The operating time,blood loss,pre-and post-operative VAS and ODI were documented.A controlled cohort study was made for percutaneous pedicle screw fixation and traditional pedicle screw placement.Results The mean blood loss was(420±45) mL.Mean pre-operative VAS was 6.85±1.03 and 1 month post-operative VAS was 1.88±0.79.Mean pre-operative ODI was 31.6±3.05 and 1 month post-operative ODI was 43.1±3.23.In navigation group,grade A was in 101 screws,B in 9 screws and C in 2 screws.And in traditional group,grade A in 86 crews,B in 21 screws,C in 4 screws and D in 1 screw.Average screw insertion time was(11.25±4.33) min and mean X-ray exposure was 2.73±0.42 in navigation group.Average screw insertion time was(15.43±5.65) min and mean X-ray exposure was 4.12±0.85 in traditional group.There were significant differences between the two groups.Conclusion Percutaneous pedicle screw fixation combine with contralateral MIS-TLIF under c-arm navigation could obtain satisfactory results in the treatment of lumbar stenosis.Percutaneous pedicle screw fixation is more accuracy,need less operating time and X-ray exposure than traditional screw placement.

nMGpwY4f.title: Effectiveness of endoscopic ulnar neurolysis and minimal medial epicondylectomy in treating cubital tunnel syndrome with ulnar nerve subluxation]
nMGpwY4f.abstract: To investigate the methods and outcome of endoscopic ulnar neurolysis and minimal medial epicondylectomy in treatment of cubital tunnel syndrome with ulnar nerve subluxation.Between June 2004 and June 2009, 11 cases of cubital tunnel syndrome with ulnar nerve subluxation were treated with endoscopic ulnar neurolysis and minimal medial epicondylectomy. There were 7 males and 4 females with an average age of 36 years (range, 18-47 years). All cases had numbness in little finger and ring finger. The disease duration varied from 3 to 18 months (7 months on average). Nine cases had atrophy in the first dorsal interosseous muscle and hypothenar muscles. The preoperative electromyography showed that the ulnar nerve conduction velocity (NCV) were slowed down at elbow, which was (27.0 +/- 1.5) m/s.All incisions healed by first intention, and no complication occurred. Eleven cases were followed up 6-37 months (19 months on average). All cases had normal sensation after 1 month of operation. The muscle strength was obviously improved in 11 cases after 3 months postoperatively (grade 4 in 7 cases and grade 3-4 in 4 cases). The postoperative electromyography showed that the NCV was obviously improved, which was (43.5 +/- 9.5) m/s, showing significant difference when compared with preoperative one (P < 0.05). According to Amadio' efficacy appraisal standard, the results were excellent in 7 cases and good in 4 cases.The method of endoscopic ulnar neurolysis and minimal medial epicondylectomy has the advantages of safety, convenient manipulation, small incision, and early recovery for cubital tunnel syndrome with ulnar nerve subluxation.
keywords: cubital tunnel syndrome ulnar nerve subluxation ulnar neurolysis medial epicondylectomy
